Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Thomas C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 2 nights. This was not a very pleasant hotel to stay at. Got a room with a double bed that was very dirty at the end of the hall by the fire exit. Elevators had a bad smell and were very slow, and one of them always seemed to be out of service. I also found the staff to be rude and inattentive. In my opinion, the only thing it has going for it is the location. I would not stay here again, and would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Beenaround73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with may aunt when we went to visit my brother in Cincinnati (cheaper to fly to Chicago and bus down to Cincy...go fig) in Sept of '10. Anyway we were visiting Chicago and picked this place for it's location to things and price. We got a good deal on a three night stay and I think I know why. This is an older building which seems to not have been updated for quite a while. The front desk was helpful in terms of addressing our concerns. Our first room was basic however it wreaked of cigarette smoke. Though the rooms are non-smoking it seems all the years of smoking are now embedded in the walls, ceiling, and carpet. We asked for another room which they did find for us. We got a slightly larger room with a kitchenette. The bathroom was nice and large since we got a handicap accessible room (this was good for my aunt). Though basic it was a nice step up from the first room. The room contained 2 full sized beds which were OK, nothing special about them. Though the room was large it was facing the street so it was noisy at night till about 1am or so. after that it was OK. The AC was old and noisy so it did help drown out some of the noise but of you don't want any noise this may not be the place for you. I wold say around a 2 star hotel and that incudes the location as a plus. It is situated between the happenings of Magnificent Mile and the large number of museums towards the southern end of town. There is also a Red Line stop a couple of blocks away for getting around. There are other hotels in the area which may be nicer and perhaps only slightly more so do our homework and compare for your intended travel dates and you could be in for a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “"There's No Place Like Home"”
Reviews.Author: StvnWllms
Reviews.Content: We usually make the Travelodge our first stay whenever we want to be in The City. It's inexpensive and located across the street from Grant Park, and within walking distance of The Chicago Museum of Art, The Field Museum and Shedd Aquarium. The Red Line Harrison Station is only two blocks away. Our first room was small and dusty. We were happily upgraded to a larger double kitchenette at no extra cost! It's not fancy, yet you do get just a bit more for your buck. The free WiFi , location just off Michigan Avenue, access to food stores, and public transportation, are major bonuses. If push comes to shove there are better hotels right across the street!

Reviews.Title: “FREE SCABIES. DIRTY ROOMS.”
Reviews.Author: bluexessence
Reviews.Content: As my first visit to Chicago and being a poor college student...I resorted to this hotel. If only I knew..I would have paid 1 million more dollars to go anywhere else. A park bench is cleaner and more safe. I got scabies (not knowing) thinking I just had a temporary itch...It turned into a 5 month HORROR FEAST of itching. EXCRUCIATING. DON'T GO HERE. I AM SERIOUS. YOU WILL GET SOMETHING..IF NOT SCABIES..BED BUGS..OR SOME DISEASE.

Reviews.Title: “Not entirely convinced!”
Reviews.Author: Chris N
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend during a visit in December 2011. There's no doubt the hotel is well located, it's a short distance from Michigan Avenue, the main Chicago shopping street. When we arrived, we spent around 15 minutes just chatting to the chap on reception and the bell boy about various things, mainly sport! All the staff are very friendly and helpful, our room safe broke at one point and they couldn't do enough to help fix it straight away. However the standard of the rooms could be slightly better, they just look a little tired. The walls & furniture look like they need updating to keep up with the competition and the bathroom was freezing. There was no source of heat to it that we could find and the window just let the icy draught right in even when shut (it wouldn't open). So you had to be very quick when using the bathroom! I'd say if Travelodge spent a bit of money updating this hotel and making the bathrooms a bit more 'user friendly' it would be a 4 or 5 star rating for sure.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Connie Z
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to EVERYthing! Staff was really great. The concierge gave us directions, a city map, and even helped us out when we wanted to ride the "L" just for the fun of it! Never needed to pay cab fare. Got to see and do everything we went to Chicago for cuz we were centrally located. Great hotel for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Wont make that mistake again!”
Reviews.Author: Craig L
Reviews.Content: The room was not clean, there was a condom wrapper under the edge of the TV stand, the carpet had dirt everywhere, the bathroom was pretty clean. The outlet that the TV plugs into, is not grounded, found that after my son plugged in his laptop. The parking garage attached to south side of the hotel was closed as of 12-11-11(signs on entrance) they failed to update that on there website, parking across the street is valet $35.00 for cars, and $42.00 for Vans or oversize vehicles. It If you want a $100.00 room and don't mind some dirt

Reviews.Title: “walking distance from the centre, next to Millenium Park”
Reviews.Author: galusjanka
Reviews.Content: great value for price and location, we had a double room with quite a small bed. but after a call to the receptionist we got a king size for $10 extra. maybe it wasn't the best hotel in the world, but for that location and price it's really worth staying there. rooms clean, service very good. worth recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Beware-- no daytime heat!”
Reviews.Author: jwindmitch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge on Harrison because it is one block from the start of the Thanksgiving day parade. Great location-- you can easily walk to the parade and back! The staff were very helpful. We asked for a crib and it was delivered immediately. They also let us check in at 10am, even though check in wasn't until 3pm. I don't think this hotel was at all full and seemed mostly to attract foreigners (which was fine by me) This hotel is a great bargain, but does have a few drawbacks. Mainly, the heat is old fashioned radiator heat. When we checked in at 10am, the heat was turned off in the guest rooms (the lobby was warm). When we called the front desk, they told us that they turn the heat on at 6pm or 7pm. It was in the upper 60's in our room during the day. This is not the hotel to hang out in in the daytime. However, when we returned after dinner, the radiators were humming away and the room was toasty warm. That night, there was a very loud noise that happened regularly-- it sounded like trucks driving over something in the garage under the building or in the alley. Also the el is a bit loud if you are not used to it (which we are). The room was clean but appeared a bit dated. However, the size of our room was quite large. We also left our son's blankie in the room and called about an hour later. They found it and kept it for us until we could pick it up a couple hours later.

Reviews.Title: “Uninformed staff, $120/night to stay in a pathetic small and OLD rooms, no refrigerators either, no smoking rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Solo T
Reviews.Content: The rooms have 90 years worth of repeated coats of paint, the windowsills are covered in a dusty half an inch of paint. The rooms are small and barren, there are NO refrigerators in the rooms. The price is way too expensive for what is offered, you will be like 120 bucks a night after taxes, and MORE on the weekends if there happens to be a conference in town. The elevators are slow, and if you smoke you are out in the cold literally, on the sidewalk being harrassed by street beggars. They even told me that Chicago had banned by city ordinance all smoking rooms in hotels. Good thing I didn't listen to these uninformed staff because I googled and then found a better room at the Essex Inn around the corner that has a whole floor dedidated to smokers so obviously there are smoking hotel rooms in Chicago and obviously the misinformed staff at the Travelodge are not worth listening to. I had a way more comfortable stay at the Essex Inn which was only 80 dollars a night compared to the ridiculous 120 at the Travelodge and the rooms are beautiful and well appointed with a refrigerator and fresh ash trays waiting for me. So rather than smoke out in the street at the Travelodge, for far less money I smoked in the warmth of my lovely room at the Essex. The Essex is orders of magnitude better than the Travelodge. Do not even bother staying at the Travelodge, it should be closed and demolished. It is a worthless steaming pile of overpriced trash. Just imagine how many other travelers have come to Chicago and stayed for days or more in the Travelodge when they wanted a smoking room but were FALSELY told by the staff that smoking is banned in all Chicago hotel rooms. A true tragedy to ever trust a word they say.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst I've been in...”
Reviews.Author: PatRussell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Travelodge in Downtown Chicago on a business trip last week and it was one of the dirtiest, most outdated places I've ever stayed. The carpet in the room was thread bare and looked disgusting as did the upholstery on the furniture. There were no washcloths in the bathroom and no water pressure in the shower. I was almost too afraid to use the bed to sleep in but I eventually succumbed to exhaustion and managed a few hours between the trains and constant people yelling on the street. The bed sheets at least appeared clean although the blanket could have been used to sand wood. Overall one of the worst hotel experiences I've had in my years of travel.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago on the cheap”
Reviews.Author: hikersfromVA
Reviews.Content: I planned a last minute girls weekend to Chicago this month and we decided to stay at the Travelodge. Although I do prefer more upscale hotels, I thought that our stay worked out great. We booked through Hotels.com. Our room was small with a modern bathroom. (No hairdryers in the room, but you can borrow one from the front desk.) The beds were comfortable and the hotel was not noisy. The carpet in the room looked old. The elevators were very slow during busy times. The front desk staff was friendly and gave good advice. The hotel is located within walking distance of the Art Institute, our main destination. it is also fairly close to the subway. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and great location”
Reviews.Author: TribalJoe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and have no complaints. Friendly staff and smooth operations. Yes, the place is a bit old, dirty and run down, but being downtown for around $130 a night, it is tough to beat. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: zeldamay10
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times over the past couple of years, The main reason is because of the price. This time, I stayed a few extra days following my business trip, and realized that the location is pretty good. It's near the lake, the art museum, and a Hilton hotel that has a fairly decent bar and restaurant. The service is good--pleasant (not terribly informed about the area but hey--the price is right).

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay for downtown events”
Reviews.Author: maldenmusic
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several years in a row when we attend the Chicago Blues Festival. It is almost right across the street from Grant Park where the festival is held and a very easy walk to Lake Michigan. The rooms are small but clean and for the price can't be beat for Chicago. There is a good Thai restaurant in the bottom part of the hotel and a Subway and Dunkin' Donuts right across the street. It is also right down the street and an easy walk from Buddy Guy's club. I wouldn't bother with the restaurant that is located in the other part of the hotel-can't remember the name of it but the food was very bland and it took forever. We never spend much time in our room when we are at the festival but it suits us just fine. They have underground valet parking which costs extra; there are a few lots across the street that cost a little less but they aren't monitored. All in all we have never had a bad experience here; the worst thing I can recall is that one of the elevators didn't work once and that it took a long time. But they were good about letting you ride up in the express elevator. I read some of the other reviews here and if they are correct then this place has really changed since we were there last in June 2011.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmsLopez81
Reviews.Content: This is the worst 'hotel' I have been to in my life. Checked in on October 20th, 2011 with my husband and sister in law and her husband. When we got there about 6pm we were immediately creeped out. The rooms and hallways were something from a horror movie!!! We changed out of our traveling clothes never left anything out because the place was absolutely disgusting. We left the room for few hours to go eat came back about 12:30am to go to bed. Well when my husband was climbing into bed he noticed a small bug in the bed he called for me and sure enough a bed bug!!!! We pulled the sheets back even further to notice that the sheets did not fit the mattress and the padding under the half sheet was full of probably every pubic hair from everyone who has stayed in room 812!!!!! I immediately called the front desk the desk employee sent up security to come check it out. They said they would upgrade us to a suite. But my sister-in-law checked her bed also at the same time and the same creepy crawlies were in her room as well!!! We then went down to the desk employe and said we wanted our money back but since our reservations were through Expedia they could not until we spoke with them. So we got them on the phone and they called this said desk employee he hung up on the Expedia employee!!! The most awful customer service I have ever seen! The desk employee never seemed concerned about the situation was more angry that we disturbed him reading his book! So at one in the morning we had to pack up our things which took no more than 5 minutes and started calling other hotels in the area. Luckily we found one or else our only other option was sleeping in our car because we were not sleeping there! We were finally refunded our money sometime late afternoon the next day after Expedia repeatedly calling the hotel to speak with the manager... will never go back! Instead of the Teddy Bear as their logo it should be a bed bug having a good night sleep on your bed. It was a horrible experience and we just got home today and everything was directly put in the dryer to make sure to kill any little bugs that could have possibly hitchhiked home with us. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price. Otherwise, BAD”
Reviews.Author: Yobabs
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my brother on this trip. We booked this hotel knowing how poorly it was rated in tripadvisor; we were looking for a reasonably-priced downtown hotel for just one night. I have to admit that it is quite well located, just a block or so from Michigan Avenue. And, at around $150 per night, it was reasonably priced. Given the lousy reviews, we knew not to expect the Taj Mahal, but we were not really prepared for what we found. We had plenty of time to enjoy the amenities of the lobby - there were none - while the front desk staff dealt with phone calls instead of servicing the check-in line. They did make some effort to bring the great outdoors inside, in the form of tons of little leaves all over the lobby floor; I was thinking that they might want to put out a collection jar so as to buy a vacuum. We were ultimately given our room keys and proceeded to the seventh floor, via an elevator that had a good-sized pool of vomit on the floor. Our rooms were right next to one another. One room key worked fine, but the other just caused red/green flickering lights on the key reader. As it turns out, this means that the door is bolted from the inside, i.e., ALREADY OCCUPIED. It took two trips to the lobby, and the eventual aid of a security guard, to figure this out, but that was the bottom line: they gave my brother a room that was already occupied. Another trip to the lobby, and he was finally given a room of his very own. The cells, er, rooms, were fairly small and showed signs of extreme old age (fair enough, for the price). I found them rather depressing. The bed was among the worst Iâ€™ve ever slept in; I am wondering if the mattress somehow predated the hotel. I had a nice view of the elevated train line, and the soundtrack to go with it. I used the heater/fan to mask some of the noise; ear plugs took care of the rest. There was no Kleenex in the room, so if you tend to travel with your nose, you might want to bring your own supply of Kleenex. The hot water worked fine in my bathroom, but my brother's bathroom could muster only a trickle. There were people hanging out in the halls at night, which seemed kind of weird, but I don't know whether that was typical. In addition, the room doors did not close on their own, which seemed a bit odd. The overall feeling of the place was not one of safety. The three tiny elevators were not nearly sufficient, especially during peak times, like 8 or 9 a.m., when everyone was heading out for the day. We had breakfast in the restaurant off the lobby; it was actually just fine, which is to say, it appeared to be unassociated with the Travelodge itself. The bellman did have the ability to check your bags for you, and could even give you claim tickets for them. We were amused and a bit concerned to find that he didn't seem to check the claim ticket numbers when giving back bags. One lady asked for hers, which she described as a pink bag with a red ribbon on it; the bellman brought out a maroon bag, sans ribbon, for her consideration, but I guess she was kind of attached to her own luggage. He finally asked her to go into the storage room and show him the one she was after. Good location, good price. Otherwise, BAD

Reviews.Title: “Big City...Tiny Hotel Room!”
Reviews.Author: LV2SURF
Reviews.Content: Myself & 3 friends all in our mid 30's stayed at the Travelodge October 14th-17th. We arrived early & the bell man was more than happy to hold our bags while we explored the great city of Chicago & waited for check-in. Normal check-in is @ 3pm, but we were able to get in our room by 2pm. There is a bank of 3 elevators, but 2 were down. However the one that was working was quite quick, and we never had to wait more than a minute or two. When we opened the door we were surprised at how small the room was. But we decided that all we were doing was sleeping & showering there...so as long as the place was clean we had no complaints. I had heard that there was an issue with "bed bugs" so I inspected the bed, before placing anything on it. I was happy to see that the mattress & box spring looked fairly new, sheets were clean & fresh, and even under the bed was spotless! The bathroom was quite small, but clean, and everything worked well...little more water pressure would have been nice. The rest of the room could use some updating, paint on the walls, change the artwork & curtains, etc. But that's all esthetics. If you're looking for somewhere to use as a home base, to simply sleep & shower...this location was great. We had no issue with street noise or train traffic. As an added bonus there is Wi-Fi in the hotel & a digital safe in the closet all at no charge. The staff at the front desk was always helpful with restaurant suggestions. Don't go next door to the cafe. Head south to Wabash & 11th, check out Eleven Diner! FANTASTIC!!! We ate breakfast there every day. Overall, if you're planning on being out & exploring the city and simply using the room to sleep & shower...this is a great place to stay. Be sure to check out the Shedd Aquarium & the Science & Industry Museum!

Reviews.Title: “Sleep in Your Car”
Reviews.Author: snardy_11
Reviews.Content: I was in town for the Chicago Marathon and stayed at the Travelodge. Let me tell you..... BIG MISTAKE! Elevators didn't work properly, my room was not cleaned properly and smelled like something died in there. There was one clean towel in my room.... ONE towel. I understand that the hotel is busy given the marathon and all, but they should make sure that they're fully stocked and ready to go. This is just part of the problem. Don't let me even get started on the staff. Out of all of the staff that I dealt with during my stay, there were only 3 people that, in my opinion, have any business being employed in the hospitality industry. One worked at the front desk. I think that Melisa was her name and the other 2 were bellman. I can't remember their names though. The rest of the staff should be on the unemployment line. In my opinion, hotel staff should be friendly and hospitable NOT snappy and b---chy. I felt like it was a struggle for them to be friendly (even fake friendly). What a joke! Where is the management at this hotel? Obviously not reading guest reviews. This hotel needs an overhaul to include the property itself as well as the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Ceg5277
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review on TripAdvisor before, but felt the need to with the Travelodge. Although the hotel is in a fantastic location in the loop, it is not worth the money. (Plus it's right next to the train tracks which makes for a lot of noise.) A few major issues: 1. the elevators. There are 3, but there were only 2 working, and on one night, only one. One of the elevators would stop on a floor, doors would open, then a few seconds later the elevator would rise another foot before finally settling. Very dangerous. I can't imagine how many people have tripped. I sure did. And that happened every time with that elevator. The inspection notices are from 2008. I'm shocked they are able to still use them. Secondly, the condition of the rooms/beds. My bed/linens as well as the shower curtain had a strong odor of stale sweat. Just really disgusting. Plus there were stains all over the carpet. I strongly recommend you spend a few more dollars and stay somewhere (anywhere) else.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for participating in Chicago Marathon”
Reviews.Author: happydazing
Reviews.Content: I had major concerns based on other reviews; however, this hotel was the PERFECT location for participating in the Chicago Marathon with a start/finish at Grant Park. The cons: not updated, one computer in lobby didn't work, super slow elevators, didn't clean room until after 5PM on day two. The pros: comfortable king bed, spacious room (1023), refrigerator (perfect for gatorades and water), location, friendly/helpful staff, clean shower, affordable for the area. I would not stay here for a romantic vacation or business travel, but it was perfect for my needs as a participant in the Chicago Marathon.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: bensbabe
Reviews.Content: Because the cost of this hotel was a fraction of other downtown Chicago hotels, it was not expecting the Ritz. I did, however, expect a functioning bathroom. We arrived in the wee hours of the morning and was not surprised that our room was very small and sparse but it was clean. We just feel into bed that night. In the morning, when I attempted to take a shower, the was not enough water pressure to even get wet and no hot water whatsoever. Fifteen minutes later the toilet broke. When it was flushed, it just kept flushing and flushing. We called the front desk and they sent someone immediately. He was able to fix the toilet after about twenty minutes. We were out all day and back in the room around 10;30 PM when the toilet broke again. This time when we tried to call the front desk, the phone was dead. This meant a trip down to the front desk. They sent another man who able to fix the toilet again but he was unable to do anything about the phone. At this point, we were offered an upgrade to a 'suite'. Each of you reading this has their idea of what constitues a suite. The room they gave us mets none of them. It was just a bigger room with the same tired furniture. The was pressure was much improved but hot water was still hard to come by. I am not telling you not to stay at this hotel. It is very resonably priced and has a great location-steps off Michigan Avenue. I am telling you that there is a reason it is so much less that the neighboring hotels. You get what you pay for. The staff is doing the best it can with what it has to work with and they did respond to our complaints immediately. If you are willing to put up with some discomfort to save money, this will work for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Thought”
Reviews.Author: ctheusa783
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Travelodge Hotel for 3 days last week. We were shopping for a hotel that was convenient to the museums, theaters, Grant Park and transportation. This location seemed to be perfect. We run a tour business and we book groups year-round and Chicago seems to always be a favorite of our clients. Upon check-in, we were greeted by a man at the front desk who was helpful and attentive as we arrived a little early. The bell captain was friendly and escorted us to our room. The room seemed nice enough for our needs. We had lunch at the restaurant which was actually better than we expected. At this point, we thought that we had found the perfect hotel. The next morning, we went to the front desk to let the agent know how pleased we were with the property. There was a woman behind the front desk with a very heavy accent who practically ignored our presence. She seemed more interested in chatting away and flirting up a storm with the bell captain. My first thought was that it was a good thing that there was a desk separating them or she may have been sitting on his lap. When we finally did get her attention, we asked her a question and she was utterly rude. It was as though we were imposing on her little tryst. In my opinion, her actions were highly unprofessional and not what I would expect to see at the front desk of a hotel. When we got back from shopping, we went to the front desk to ask about restaurants in the area. The agent at the desk in the evening was helpful and gave us some options. The next morning, when we were coming out of the elevator we were greeted by the bell captain and went to the restaurant for breakfast. When we walked out of the restaurant, the same woman as the previous morning was there AGAIN chatting up the bell captain. We stopped to ask him a question and while he was very gracious and helpful, she gave us a glare that could have killed. At that point, my mind had been made up. We would not be giving this hotel our business. On a positive note, our room attendant was quite friendly and seemed to be very conscientious about her work. When we checked out the same man who checked us in was at the front desk and asked how our stay was and seemed to be genuinely interested. I wanted to tell him about our good and bad experiences, but I thought better of it and just told him that everything had been fine. The bell captain helped us with our bags to the cab and again was very gracious. This would have been the perfect property for our needs, but we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible.”
Reviews.Author: steph42086
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel when visiting friends for a weekend in July. When we got there to check in (after check in time) the room was not ready. So we decide to park the car in the garage close to the hotel. It took so long to park by the time we got done the room was ready. We walk into a room that just looked crusty. Everything looked dirty. I called to the front desk and asked for fresh sheets. Why did it take so long for the room to be "ready" if they didn't actually clean it? The bathroom was nice and remodeled but also dirty. There was hair in the bathtub and the bathroom trash had not been emptied. We tried to call different hotels to move to but everything in the area was booked (due to July 4th weekend and the Ribfest). Luckily we were only there for 2 short nights but we will never go back there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Listed as a 2 star hotel and that's about right”
Reviews.Author: Jeff O
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Chicago on a last minute business trip and got jammed with very little availability for the week I was visiting. I went ahead and selected this hotel knowing that it probably wasn't going to impress me and it didn't. The staff was helpful and courteous and they did the best with what they had. They upgraded me to a "king room" when I checked in, which was a nice gesture but didn't work out so well for the following reasons; 1. My room was literally right across from the elevator so it was a bit noisy 2. Adding to that my room faced the "L" train which you could hear as every train came by 3. The A/C seemed to struggle to keep the room cool enough and was also on the loud side. 4. Two of the four nights I stayed there the room key card didn't work so I had to go back down to the front desk and had them rekey they card, at least it worked 2 out of 4 times. A two star is probably accurate based on my experience. This hotel has seen better days and is somewhat worn out and tired.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Hostel 10 times the value”
Reviews.Author: tjungroth
Reviews.Content: This room had sewer back up in the tub for three day after we told the front desk. Then a guy fixed in an hour when we brought this up at the front desk we were told "well we offered you a change of rooms" never did say sorry for the issue. talked to other staying they had bad issues also if you are desperate and need a place to stay you get less then you pay for! but it is beeter then the street!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: yvettecos
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel in advance. Checked in. Room was disgusting: filthy carpet (puke stains between beds) rusted exposed pipes in room, mattresses were concave and looked like they came from a landfill, had one chair in the room with torn upholstery. In short this is your worst nightmare of a hotel. We immediately checked out and booked a last minute reservation at Hampton Inn River North. At least we weren't charged. Stay away from this place. It is too depressing to think that you could die in a flop house like this.

Reviews.Title: “Ok value for a place to lay your head”
Reviews.Author: atmontejo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2009, Booked at the last minute and was the best deal i could find in central Chicago. The hotel is really well placed, dated, but it is what it is. Rooms could be cleaner or more modern, but it was ok. Has a chinese restaurant connected to it downstairs which did decent food at decent prices. Well situated to the parks, art museum and shopping. Chicago is an expensive place to stay so saving a few pounds or dollars on a room can always help. If I was ever back in Chicago, if this is still the cheapest option I can find, then can't see why I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RichIII_88
Reviews.Content: Visited Chicago two years ago and had to come back. Stayed somewhere else last time. Got this room through the Priceline "Pick Your Price" bid. I didn't even know what I was getting until it was charged to my credit card. I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised. The location of the hotel is really great. Close to some major attractions, the subway, the bus, and downtown is a block away. They have two restaurants on site. One a Thai and Sushi place and the other one just does breakfast and lunch, American style. My wife and I ate at both restaurants during our three day stay. Both restaurants were reasonably priced and the food was very good. Our room had a kitchenette which was an unexpected surprise. The bathroom was huge! It was lacking on counter space to store stuff, but had a full length mirror and another closet. We had a safe in the closet to store valuables. It did need fresh batteries to get it to work. A call to the front desk and someone came and fixed it within 5 minutes. The maintenance man was also very knowledgeable about the city and told us which buses to take to get to certain attractions. His advice was spot on! The room itself was very large and had a couch, dresser, and a desk with a nice office chair. The only bad thing about the whole experience was the air conditioner was a bit undersized for the room. The temp in the room the first night was a bit high, but it got better the other two nights. The whole hotel could use a bit of a ventilation makeover as it wasn't just our room that was warm. All in all our experience at the Travelodge was very nice. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: cheeser73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and needs a serious makeover, I even felt dirty taking a shower there! But worst of all, my friend who was staying there HAD BUG BITES on his body after sleeping there.

Reviews.Title: “Average might be a stretch”
Reviews.Author: T M
Reviews.Content: I understand it is a very historic city that's why I love it, so old buildings can't be perfect. The location was good and so was the price. The room was not very clean, very cramped not big enough to comfortably accommodate a family of 4. One bed was pushed against the wall the other was maybe have 1-2 feet there with little room in between. The bathroom was poorly designed has a pedistool sink with next to no space for any toiletries. I don't base much of my vacation on my hotel because that's not why i'm there but it was just so hard to relax when you went into your room because it was just so cramped in there. Not sure if I would recommend to someone but if it's the only hotel you can afford at least it's a good location..

Reviews.Title: “Never will come back”
Reviews.Author: J B
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I've never written a review until now. ROOMS ARE DIRTY, CARPET IS DIRTY, AND YOU CAN SEE WHERE THEY NEVER SWEEP UNDER THE BED, IN THE CORNERS, ETC. THE WORST: MY WIFE HAD BUG BITES ALL OVER HER FEET FROM THE BEDDING. We complained to the desk and was told "it's a free night if you are bitten by bed bugs". Seems this has happened before. I spoke to the owner as we left and he was supposed to call us after he investigated. No call and after my repeated calls to him - so far - none returned. The bell hops were the only ones who seemed to have their act together. Will NEVER stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “just right”
Reviews.Author: Smudgepuss
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in April. we went for it because we are familiar with Travelodge in the UK and wanted something easy after our long flight. it ids perfectly located for sight seeing. breakfast is available in the cafe next door serving excellent choices. very reasonably priced. would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and great lcation”
Reviews.Author: Mike K
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews, we were hesitant to stay here, but wanted something closer to the Lolla festival. I had three rooms reserved and all were very clean and comfortable. The location was excellent and we couldn't have asked for a better value. The rooms looked quite updated with newer carpet, furnishings, towels, etc. All hotel staff were courtious and friendly. If you are looking for value and comfort, this is the place. If you are looking for luxury and being pampered, you'll need to spend a lot more to get your butt powdered.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad”
Reviews.Author: sniff07
Reviews.Content: The hotel isn't as bad as everyone says it is. The room is small but what do you expect for the price and being in a major city. If you don't mind walking then everything is in walking. The red line is like a block away. The gentlemen that works night seemed to know more about the downtown area then the other front desk people. I didn't think it was as bad as everyone says it was.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok..”
Reviews.Author: tman9940
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 7-18-11 till 7-20-11. We notified the hotel we were going to be ariving about 7 hours before checkin time. They still would not let us check in early. They did however take our luggage which was nice. There is a nice little take out place with good quick food on the hotel property. The heat was unbearable in the city when we got there--so we couldn't wait to get into the air conditioned room. The airconditioning worked, but only blew out room temperature air! Overall, this hotel is good for a place to rest your head and that is about it! Would recomend it for young singles, but no one else!

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel - clean, location bit of walk to anything”
Reviews.Author: ST61938
Reviews.Content: the rooms here were ok - clean for the most part. i was there for 3 nights and my room was not made up the first night, but was the other two. this area there arent many restaurants and it is bit of a walk or taxi to get to some. seems this area closes down a bit early. overall the rooms are a little small, had to request an iron to be brought up to the room, other than that relatively inexpensive and not bad option to get to my office.

Reviews.Title: “Great family trip!”
Reviews.Author: ncteachermom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because my husband had a convention to go to downtown and this hotel had the most reasonable rates for the location. After reading the reviews, I was very nervous about staying there. However, we were very surprised. I am a light sleeper and I worried that the train noise some people had talked about would keep me up. I asked to be away from that side of the hotel and they put us far away from the noise and I never heard anything! Plus, we had the AC/fan on most of the time, so that probably helped with any noise we might have heard from people staying near us as well. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. At the end, they even loaded up our luggage for us and helped us to the car for no fee! We felt safe and we thoroughly enjoyed our time there. The location was perfect for seeing many areas of downtown, the Magnificent Mile and the Museum campus. I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Even if you offered me money I would not stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: Duffylou
Reviews.Content: I never unpacked my suitcase for fear my clothes would get dirty. Our first room had cockroaches so I asked to be moved. We did receive another room. When my daughter and I returned from dinner there was a stench so overwhelming we couldn't stay in the room for maintenance to come. They were not going to move us so I went down to the lobby and became a bit vocal. They found a room. We had no problem for the rest of our 5 night stay. The only reedeming quality was the "conceirge" and unfortunately, I don't remember his name. I must say, despite this hotel, we still had a marvelous time in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, quiet, walking distance to many sights, restaurants, and attractions.”
Reviews.Author: tokenhippygirl
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here. Clean and quiet room in a fantastic location. Just a block off Michigan Avenue and the park. Walking distance to the museum complex, Millennium Park, and the L. Booked through a third party and got a great price. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price* Great location* Safe area* Clean*”
Reviews.Author: nesrah
Reviews.Content: This was our first family trip to Chicago and we were on a tight budget. We felt very safe in the location. We enjoyed our walks to Grant Park, Buckingham Fountian (which took our breath away with it's beauty) and Michigan Ave. all within a one to two block area. This is a budget friendly hotel that is clean, and safe-no extras. If you are ok with that, this is the place for you. The hotel had booked us in the wrong room. We had a print out of the agreement with us. We never had to give it to them, as they gave us a free upgrade that was better then what we had hoped for as soon as we alerted them of their mistake. We booked this hotel not expecting much as it was the lowest priced hotel we could find after days of trying to find something cheap for our family in a safe area. The room was clean. It looks dated (you would not post facebook photos from the room) but we didnt care. The bathroom was large, clean and updated. We did not find a blow dryer or iron in the room-but had expected that for the price. We paid $129.00 a night for three nights. We were on the top floor (12) and from our window we had a great view of the elevated red line. This was awesome for us as we traveled with my eight year old boy, who loved to just watch it go by. For anyone else... the noise has the potential to disturb your sleep if you are a light sleeper. The hotel provides free WiFi. The housekeeper was on our floor for what seemed like hours a day. She always had her cart stocked with supplies. We didn't mind walking down a hall for extra supplies, instead of waiting until she got to our room. She keep to herself, but was friendly when providing service. When I read reviews all I heard about was how slow the elevators were. What the issue is - in the morning a lot of people are using the elevators, each of the three elevators only holds seven people-therefor, people have to wait. I say big deal...allow yourself an extra 5 minutes in the morning to save a hundred dollars a night. This is a non-smoking hotel. There is a standing area in the front that is provided for the smokers. It's nice in the morning as the sun is facing the smoking area and it's fun area to people watch. I always came across appropriate, well behaved people in the area of this hotel. The hotel seemed to be filled with families, people who were there for out of town meetings, couples both gay and straight, and people who were there for special events in the area-games and concerts. Every staff member we came across smiled when we smiled at them. The staff does not offer information or initiate conversation. When asked they know so much about the city-the lady at the desk helped to plan our out trip by bus! This was after I told her we figured out the day trip we wanted to take by the Hide Park area of Chicago would cost a total of sixty dollars round trip by taxi! She went as far as giving us a print out. I made sure to talk to the staff during the non-busy times to get additional information and attention from them. There is a diner/grill type cafe to eat at right off the lobby. The cafe also sells snacks to take on your adventures. The guy at the front counter is very pleasent there too. The cafe is mostly open for breakfast/lunch hours. If you need a fast cheap meal you can also go right across the street. You will find a Dunkin Donuts/Baskin Robins, KFC/Pizza Hut and a Sub Way sandwhich shop. Taxi service is easy to find in front of the hotel. The longest we waited was about four minutes. The only service I can think of that would have made this budget friendly hotel better is... The hotel could have a sign or some form of written communication alerting it's customers of all the great site seeing locations that are so near by. If you have never been to a big city before Chicago can be very overwhelming. This hotel is in a great location and could market that better to its out of town customers.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you need to.”
Reviews.Author: SMTS_11
Reviews.Content: I feel sorry for those in charge of running this hotel. The location is very good, but can't so much more than that on the PROs side of things. Plenty of CONs: - price: seems reasonable, but for what you get/hassle it is actually too much. e.g. $180 for a room with two double-beds (on a booked-solid conference weekend across the city) - condition: The place is old and falling apart, literally. Not only furniture and decor, but basics. In our first room, when I turned on the sinks hot water some brown sludge came up, momentarily. The blinds were ripped and had holes. Both my friend and I had incessant trouble with the magnetic keys opening out room door. (Staff said don't store them close to a cellphone or iPod is would demagnetize them.... ya, right!). The final straw in that room was that the door would simply not lock when leaving! We requested a room change at that point. (We were no frills travelling but there are basic essentials that must be met!) - infrastructure: in the "new" or second room, there was low water pressure and hardly hot water. The same room key problem remained with that roomlock too, however, at least it locked. The elevator was VERY slow. - service: given the above we requested a reduction in room price. They were resistant, although I am quite sure that these issues and complaints repeat with every second visitor. Eventually we got 25% off (they originally suggested 10%). As mentioned, I do feel sorry for the staff. With a building like this, you are in a losing battle. It needs a complete overhaul. So, they cannot be happy service providers when they know that most inquiries are probably going to actually be complaints. - location is very good. BUT, watch where your room is located. If on the west side of the building the L-line will be going past you and it can be quite loud.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LCSMICH
Reviews.Content: It is a dirty old hotel that does not care about the remodeling, the beds are almost a hammock, when we reached the room, the bathroom door had hung on a dirty towel from the previous host, One day the maid forgot one of the cleaning articles, donÂ´t put enough towels, do not change the sheets daily, the exterior windows has heavy soil, could make the effort to clean them once a year, metro rail noise not allowed you to rest as it passes half a block. The course has access to transmission lines, I did not know how safe it was at night. I do not recommend this hotel, the cost can find something better.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoHereICome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge as there was literally nothing available for less than Â£500 a night over graduation weekend. The hotel is dated and there were very basic amenities. The towels and bedding were all clean, however around the edges of the carpets had a thick layer of dust. The location is this hotels redeeming feature. It is right by Grant Park and located a block away from Harrison on the Red CTA Line. Breakfast is not provided but there were a few places to eat across the road and a 7 Eleven around the corner for sundries. For what we paid we would ordinarily have been able to stay in a four star hotel, but we were so grateful to find this affordable hotel so it was easy to look past it's minor flaws.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever - worth less than $20/day”
Reviews.Author: Enjoy_Honest
Reviews.Content: Had to stay at this hotel as all other hotels in the area where booked solid because of a conference. No wonder, this place still had rooms available where else all other hotels were booked. That should have been a clue. Very bad hotel. Horrible rooms and service. The clock did not work. Asked front desk for a wakeup call in the morning for a very important meeting. Needless to say, the call never happened!! and they did not have a good explanation as to why. Don't waste your time. It you have no other option in the area, you're better off staying at a good place farther away and pay taxi fare to get where you want.

Reviews.Title: “The rudest front-desk agents I have ever come across.”
Reviews.Author: anouvalex
Reviews.Content: Horrible hotel. Rooms were old and smelly, and they only cleaned them closer to 5pm. TV remote did not work, even after they replaced it once. Water in the bathtub was not draining. They charged me for leaving luggage with them for a couple of hours after check-out. I have stayed in many hotels and never had this before. More strangely they did not charge everyone among our group, and when I asked then why they told me that I should not make a deal out of it because it is just a dollar a bag. When I pressed them further they asked me to leave the lobby and wait for my cab outside. Would never stay there even if the whole city had no rooms available.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Night Sleep Ever”
Reviews.Author: heyU311
Reviews.Content: I seriously never write bad reviews but this time I felt that I had to. I got a room accross the street from this big exam I have to take so I can be well rested and also not be late to the exam. I had the worst night of sleep ever. The walls are paper thin. I can literally hear every word people are saying from both rooms next to me. And when someone would raise their voice, it would wake me up... I have literally been woken up at least 8 times. One time the building was making a loud banging noise, I have no idea what that was... Great price but I totally would have spent another $50 to get some sleep... The room itself had stains on the carpet and chairs.... Sheets and blankets were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at an affordable rate”
Reviews.Author: janicetran
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near 2 train lines and is in a great part of downtown. The hotel itself doesn't offer much, but my friend and I barely spent time in it anyway. The staff was friendly, the hotel is clean, the wifi is fast, and the beds are comfortable. There is a thai place and a cheap coffee shop downstairs. Go here for the location and cheap price, but not much else.

Reviews.Title: “Surprizingly good hotel by European standards.”
Reviews.Author: Sassyass
Reviews.Content: That would be Eastern European standards. Let's be honest; this is a discount hotel not the Marriott. I was in Chicago for 5 days to do a job and I was expecting a real dump. I stay in discount hotels in small towns across the county for $20 to $30. Being in the center of a large city, prices were about double. But you won't find anything noticeably cheaper than the Travel Lodge unless you stay at the hostel about a block away. It was easy walking distance to the subway red line, even for an old man with moderate gout. Hell, I could throw a snowball that far in my day. The neighborhood felt safe to me with many elderly folks and college aged girls walking around alone even after 10:00 pm. It was 5 or 10 minutes to the center of Chicago where Michigan Ave crosses the Wacker river. Fast food was convenient with Dunkin Donuts, Subway, KFC, Pizza hut across the street and many more expensive eateries and watering holes in the neighborhood. The staff was courteous and helpful. Not many people were there and it was quiet. No mammalian, insect, avian, or fungal pests were observed. The sheets were clean, the room stayed warm in winter time, the electricity worked, the toilets flushed, hot water came out of the shower. Several clean towels along with small samples of soap, shampoo and lotion along with paper, pens, a phone book and a Bible were provided. The phone worked for calls coming ina nd I did not make any calls. I did not use the safe, coffee machine, TV, or iron. The place was dated and had been partially remodeled a few times giving it sort of an avande gros or tacky look depending on your tastes. A combination of the Thai restaraunt on the first flooor, strong cleaning chemicals and nearby Lake Michigan gave the hotel a rather unusual odor, but not unpleasant to me. The train lines being so close were audible at times, reminding me of the quaintness of being in the big city.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the pennies you save.”
Reviews.Author: rybrooks8
Reviews.Content: Not that we were expecting elegance and pampering by choosing a Travelodge, but the place is a complete dump and in serious need of an upgrade. We chose it to save money, but it really wasn't worth it. My wife was afraid to sleep on the bed, and I'm fairly certain that there were several "professional services" being run out of adjacent rooms. Three things that the hotel does have going for it: the staff was courteous, there is a killer breakfast joint connected to it, and it's within walking distance of shops and restaurants. Regardless, I won't ever stay there again, and I certainly don't recommend it. Spend a few more bucks - it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz, but a great deal”
Reviews.Author: bratprincede
Reviews.Content: For the bad, the room had one bed and we were squeezed together. The rug had an iron burn on it. You have to request an iron and board. The parking lot across the street gives you a fixed rate for your stay where you can come and go, was about 140 dollars for 6 days. There are two places to eat in the hotel, one has sushi, which while not the freshest was great to just go down. Location was great, we could get most downtown places in minutes. Would I stay here again? For my vacations I want a clean room, no pests, and a good price, they delivered all of that and more. So yes, I would. If I wanted a romantic get away, no I wouldn't.

Reviews.Title: “You cannot beat this prime location!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrMuse
Reviews.Content: I've read some of the reviews and I must say that I'm astonished by some of the bad reviews. I did not deal with any rude staff members or bed bugs. In fact it was quite the opposite. The staff was more than helpful. They held our luggage, called a taxi for us and even let us get our room earlier than the allotted check in time. The room and fairly simple. It was more than adequate enough for two people. My only regret is not having a fridge. The room did come with an ice bucket and that is how we kept our beer cold. A lot of the reviews also seem to focus on the grandeur of the rooms. For the location this hotel is a super deal in Chicago. If you stay 2 nights you get 20% knocked off and 3 nights you get 30% knocked off. The red line subway is only a block away which makes all the touristy area's very user friendly. Shed's Aquarium, The John Hancock Building and several of other places are within in walking distance. If your a light sleeper you might want to bring some ear phones because at times you can hear the trains rolling by but overall this is a good place to stay. I mean how long are you really going to spend in your hotel anyway? Especially if the trip is for leisure purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs time”
Reviews.Author: ThaCet
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed at the Travelodge in Chicago during 4 nights and it was correct if you don't mind having bedbugs. The people didn't offer any nights for it and they were laughing...

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location!”
Reviews.Author: Chrisallen2004
Reviews.Content: As a Budget Hotel, you could not fault it, Although the decor was a bit tried, the rooms were very clean and the staff helpful. Great location for walking to the Pier, parks and shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Silvercouple
Reviews.Content: Was a little worried after reading some reviews but we should not have worried at all. The location of this hotel is great gentle stoll to grant and millenium park. Close to transport links and food out lets. The staff where fab very friendly and helpful. The room was good. clean, plenty large enough(bed was massive) , plenty of clean towels etc. only critisism as a previous reviewer has stated very warm we too had to turn down the heating and use the fan or AC. All areas of the hotel were clean the corridor, reception lifts etc. Yes the hotel is old but has great character and we had a fab view of the Willis tower. Would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and super staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jkeena
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great spot, we were within walking distance to the bus and rail lines, so we did not have to get a car. There are 2 restaurants on site and many nearby. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is classic, with lots of character, but is in need of an update. The rooms were not dirty, but not really clean either. The room was large and had a great view of the Sears (Willis) Tower. If you are in town to see the city on a budget, this hotel is a great choice. If you are looking for a hotel with lots of things to do on-site, this is not the one for you. For the price, location and staff, I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Shopaholic1962
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Travelodge we were greeted quite rudely by front desk person Julia who then proceeded to pick a fight with my sister. I have never in my life met such an unprofessonal and rude individual that works the front desk at a hotel. This was just the icing on the cake, rooms were horrible and old. When you were in the bathroom it felt like the artic due to the old windows. To end our glorious stay there, I killed a cockroach in the bathroom. Thank god it was the last day we were staying there. NEVER AGAIN WILL I STAY AT THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving day stay in HELL !!!”
Reviews.Author: danp3359
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel after parade, room had two towels and no toilet paper (we were dropping off our stuff after the Chicago parade. Upon leaving to go back out , I asked for add'l towels and Toilet paper, was told that it would be taken care of. Returned four hours late neither was done called down and was told I could pick up my toilet paper in the lobby, had to go to lobby to get toilet paper and towels . TV in kids room didn't work maint. came about an hoour after calling and told me htere was nothing they could do. Then the head board attached to the wall by the kids bed fell on my daughters hand, called and maint came about 8:30 p and decided to fix it, took about an hour and half. Service personnel were terrible and acted like idiots, would rather sleep in parkinglot across the street than sleep at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Excellent Location... but must note 1 thing!!”
Reviews.Author: bbkwong
Reviews.Content: The good: Great location (close to Michigan Ave and all the bus stops including the no. 3 which goes to the McCormick Convention center) as you can walk to Millennium park and many food venues are nearby, Subway sandwich, Epic Burger along with CVS and 7-Eleven. L-station nearby (Red line). With this value in the Loop, this place is excellent. The staff is exceptionally diligent and tried their best to help me with my questions. I just felt that they are passionate about Chicago and their hotel. My room and lobby are spotless. The con: Noise ! the L is the problem but I can deal with that. But the BIGGEST problem is, there are two food venues attached to the travelodge: A Thai place and a Deli. The Deli is Ok but they closed at 7pm. DO NOT TRY the THAI place unless you are one of the following: (1) You want to try the worst Thai/Japanese food of all time in any standard; (2) You enjoy over-priced food and being pre-charged gratitude without your knowledge. To me, that Thai place is dishonest and go else where if you want decent Asian food.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: travelplanner049
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Travelodge Downtown Chicago was anything but pleasurable. The rooms were dark, musty, worn and extremely filthy. The carpet was dreadfully grimy and had suspicious droppings by the bed frame. The bed sheets and chairs were stained and unkempt. Noise from the radiator heater, train and road made it impossible to sleep. Hotel staff was rude and short. When asked to be assigned another room they simply sent the cleaning staff up with rubber gloves and a trash bag to remove the droppings off the floor and told us it would be fine. Upon leaving early to check into another hotel the front desk attendant told us there was no refund and we needed to stay and â€œtough it out,â€� while still refusing to give us a different room. Donâ€™t stay here-there are much better places for roughly the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: robinnorman
Reviews.Content: Everybody in the hotel staff was very freindly. They let us get in our room early even though check-in time wasn't until 3pm. The room was larger and cleaner than the room we spent 3X more for in New York City. The location was great for sight seeing and close to the metro. There are plenty of places to eat all around the hotel. The only negative thing I could say about the hotel is the noise. I heard that the rooms in the back are the quietest, but we had one on the 11th floor in the front and you could hear the train all night. But with the price and the location, it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location”
Reviews.Author: dking911
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in easy walking distance to Grant Park and Soldier Field. If you prefer Taxis, they are numerous in front of the hotel. The red line is also only a couple of blocks away. The Hotel is older and could use some updating but then again it is a very good value if you just need a place to sleep. If you insist on luxury then this is not the place for you. The staff was very friendly and helpful throughout the stay, even when we requested a roll away bed for the last night so a friend could stay in our room. In general the entire Hotel could use a good cleaning but overall the stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it...location was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: JillKuch
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an inexpensive place to stay in Downtown Chicago for a wedding this summer. The location was great, right off the Magnificent Mile and the service was great too. There was convenient parking right across the street (you almost always have to pay separate for parking but it was very easy to get the car in and out, and we still paid less for the room & parking than we would have spent at another hotel just for the room.) Close for public transport too. It was not an upscale place, but the value was much more inportant to us! Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, don't expect too much.”
Reviews.Author: waslka21
Reviews.Content: Location was good, a few blocks (walking) from Grant Park. Hotel and room was average. We stayed in a room with 2 double beds. The room was very small. Beds weren't that great. The shower sucked! No water pressure, so it took me 10 mins to rinse shampoo out of my hair. Parking is in a parking lot across the street from the hotel and is $28 per day. The price of the hotel was moderate for downtown Chicago, $154 per night with a AAA discount. But I have stayed in nicer hotels downtown for less.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Problem”
Reviews.Author: Abhay25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Travelodge, 65 E.Harrison, Chicago on October 4 & 5, I was supposed to stay one more night but had to leave and pay for another hotel. I was bitten and had swollen red patches on my arm (4-5 areas), my neck, my cheek. They were very itchy, large red blotches, the size of dimes. I had business meetings - what a nightmare. Now I am worried about going home and any bed bugs in my luggage/clothes. I notified the hotel management and front desk staff. They said they would check into it. A very old hotel, very old carpets and furnishings. This hotel is one of the cheapest and often included in Orbitz/Travelocity in a very cheap air+hotel package - but avoid it - please - don't suffer like I did.

Reviews.Title: “IMTS 2010”
Reviews.Author: irishman864
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel for one night for the I.M.T.S. show and we were impressed. Got to Chicago at 10:00 a.m. and just wanted to check our luggage with a bellman, but they said our room was available and we could check in, after a three and a half hour car ride that is good news. Staff is very freindly and the location is great. We did not live in the room so if you are looking for a clean room, a comfortable bed, and a shower that works this is a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: patproc7
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we were on a budget so I was a little nervous about what we would find when we arrived. The hotel was the cheapest in the downtown area, but I was pleasantly surprised by how nice the staff was and how clean the room was. It was a clean, comfortable room and from the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out everyone we encountered on the staff was friendly and helpful. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Chicago on a budget. There are two restaurants attached to the hotel and convenient access to parking. The hotel is not far from the Red Line making it easy to get anywhere in Chicago quickly. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bproctor
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value. We were traveling on a tight budget so when we booked this hotel, which was the absolute rock-bottom cheapest we could find, we were expecting to be staying in a dump. But surprisingly the hotel was very nice, clean, and definitely a good value. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. Obviously, this is no 5 star hotel, but for the money it was definitely a good choice. Tips: Park across the street from the main entrance in the parking garage. The valet will park your car for you. They will give you a ticket that you need to get validated at the hotel. This will save you about $5/day on parking.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: pitufo00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge for two nights. The rooms were dark, worn and tired. Cramped space. Can't see out of the windows if you are short unless you stand on the bed. Worn carpet, blankets on bed looked like they had not been cleaned in a while. Cleaning staff did not come to our room, so beds were not made, sink and bathtub were not cleaned and toilet paper was not replaced (and we had three of us and were afraid we would run out). Location is OK - we were able to walk and/or take the Water Taxi to destinations, but there are other hotels closer to the action. As I only paid $71 a night for a special promotion, I can't complain about the price, but I guess you get what you pay for. We moved to another hotel for our third night there - located at Wacker and Wabash - and the room was large, clean and wonderful. That night cost us $200 and was well worth it. My advice is to look for deals, but also read the reviews and be prepared. A very low price might look attractive but you may be very unhappy once you get there. And for a bonus: When I got home and checked my bank statement, I found an additional charge for 1Â¢. Are you kidding me? Someone bothered to charge something for a penny? Next trip to Chicago will not find me staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: Eisaksrx
Reviews.Content: It is probably difficult to find a hotel near Chicago center where you don't have a wall in few meters from your window. I got such room. It was difficult to sleep due to noise at night, but I didn't understand where it came from. Every morning I had to wake up because something switched on and feeling was as to sleep in the train. This is a cheap hotel, but you must prepared that you will be disturbed by the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrible/scammers”
Reviews.Author: lcantrell89
Reviews.Content: Our mistake for not reading the reviews of this hotel before we stayed there. Some friends and I stayed at the travelodge while we were in town for a concert. The front desk misinformed us about parking. My car was towed. We had to pay for a cab to go pay to get my car out of the lot after we had already paid for parking. When we confronted the desk staff of this we were told by KEN "Well, you girls will learn a hard lesson" in a way a disappointed/angry father would. He was very rude to us throughout our stay. When we went to check out and pay, my friend's card was declined. She called the bank and Travelodge had charged over $500 on her card the previous day which caused her to overdraft. When we brought it to KEN's attention, he kept trying to shrug it off as though he had been wiped clean of us now that they had our money. We called the toll free number on the card while we were in the lobby, thinking it was a corporate number. When we heard the phone ring at the front desk we hung up. KEN, then looked at us with a cold, maniacal, angry glare. Oh, and aside from the rude, unhelpful staff, the rooms were disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: libriut99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in August 2010 as part of my trip. The location is very good with most attractions and the city center at a walking distance. For the Navy pier and the magnificent mile you"ll probably better off with taking the train with a station located a block away. The rooms were nothing fancy but met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping a little bit better than in a subway”
Reviews.Author: EisakaB
Reviews.Content: Location is good, but hotel has to be either renovated or closed. This was my first trip to US and this is the only hotel I visited, therefore I can compare the price/quality only with European hotels. Maybe that's a standard quality in US? If it is Ok for you to stay in a room, where everything is very old, you won't be able to sleep because of extreme noise around you (sometimes it was same as to sleep in a tractor). All the noise from the street you can perfectly hear, as window frames are old and bad insulated. I tried to spend as much time as possible outside the hotel and returned always tired to be able to fall asleep immediately. Don't repeat my mistake and pay a little bit more for other hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Roadwarriors5
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful doorman and front desk. Room was more like a double room with two beds and two TVs. It had an area with a sink, microwave and frig. The room was clean and bathroom newly remodeled. The location was great, just a couple of blocks from Buckingham Fountain. When we arrived, the remote for one of the TVs didn't work. A call to the front desk and three minutes later, a couple of guys were there to fix the problem. The best thing was the charm of the old building. The worst thing was the elevators were a little slow, but not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “STAY ONLY IF IT'S FREE”
Reviews.Author: Xcetra
Reviews.Content: 245PM Checked In......was made to wait till 415 before I got a room. Was tired after an international flight, so was sleeping in the lobby on a chair with my luggage as a foot rest. The clerk Ken, was absolutely the worst customer service person I've ever come accross in my life. Not only was he extremely rude and cold, but believe it or not threatning as well. For example, I'd put my pen up, to sign in at check in.....he indicated 'Put that pen down sir, I'll tell you when it's time to sign', or something like that. Another guest was waiting with me, so when after 90 minutes we were called in to finally check-in , this person excitedly gesitculated at me to join him at check-in . Ken asked him if if I was with him, and when this guest said no, he was told to mind his own business. I could go on and on. The room was misereably small, and the coffee machine so old, that all the water accumulated in the filterr basket, and I nearly got scalded. The windows were old and and actually stuffed with sponge to keep the cold air out. The only saving grace was housekeeping, that I have to say. The hotel is near an Elevated Station, and there is constant noise of trains braking towards the station approach. Don't let the Michigan Avenue proximity fool you ; It is 'South Michigan', rather than North, and a very old, rundown area. The hotel reflects the same. I'd called head office, to lodge a complaint, but as expected it was all lip service,and no calls (around 5 of them) returned. If they say 'All complaints are taken seriously' it is an obvious lie. Calls to the general manager were not returned as well. Stay at you own peril.

Reviews.Title: “Travel-Agidda”
Reviews.Author: Ashurbanipol
Reviews.Content: To begin with I made the mistake of booking through an internet booking site, thus paying 50% more than most of the guests for the same or lesser rooms. My fault, not the hotel's, but it doesn't help. While the website advises that the hotel is "close to Union Station" it is in fact a full mile away. Check-in was awful; we arrived around noon and were allowed to store our bags until the 3pm check-in time, about which they were very strict: by 3pm, the lobby was filled with over 40 people who had arrived at various times during the afternoon but were not permitted to check in until exactly 3pm. The rooms have no irons or ironing boards; no mini bar; no microwave; things you'd get standard even at a much cheaper roadside location. Each room had a radiator and an air conditioning unit build into the window such that the window could not be opened; this became a problem during the night when the power in the room failed in the stifling heat. The desk clerk responded to my complaint that the circuits were overloaded and nothing could be done. That's probably true; the overhead light switch in the room sparked when I switched it! At one point during the day at least one of the elevators got stuck and a guest had to climb out. The free "high-speed" internet is so slow that a short video would take close to an hour to download. The shelf over the sink in our bathroom was broken, leaving absolutely no place to store toothbrushes, etc. Water pressure in the shower was poor (although we were on a high floor in this 12-storey building). We expected a complimentary continental breakfast, as their website advertised this, but when we got there, they told us they'd stopped doing that - although that's one of the features I'd paid for. The location is excellent - a block from the CTA Red Line and a block or so from Buckingham Fountain - in a very noisy but busy and safe area of the city. Despite the check-in fiasco and their inability to fix the power outages, the staff was very friendly and tried to be helpful. The "fully equipped" business center consisted of one computer and a non-functioning printer. This place was so much cheaper than anything else in the city, I should have realized it was too good to be true. I'd recommend it, because for the difference in price I'd volunteer to suffer. It's a glorified hostel, and if you can deal with that, this place is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice night workers, small rooms, and lied about free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: elmerfudgr46802
Reviews.Content: Went there Mon-Fri last week with two small children. First of all even through the website said free breakfast there is NOT. Asked why, rudly told they do not do that anymore. Would have gone somewhere else that was 10 more a night if I had know that (if you have kids you understand why) The room was small, at first clean. There was a smell the first couple of days, didnt fiqure it out until the last day. My son found three rotten plums under a nightstand, told the checkout lady and she just said sorry. Only upside was that the evening/night workers were super nice (one of the gentlemen was very helpful and even went above what was his job,), day workers were rude and not very helpful. The Red line is just two blocks away and several fast food places one street away. One more thing to watch id when you check out I was nearly charged 100 dollars more, and when this was pointed and finally fixed person was very rude about this. Will not go back,because of misleading, and the cleaning issuse.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and fair price. Room is...”
Reviews.Author: chchris
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and fair price. Room is not very big, but nice bath. Only the A/C was a bit loud and you couldn't open the window, but I allways will recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pay the extra money, get a better room”
Reviews.Author: SpngbblvS
Reviews.Content: I spent the night at the Travelodge Downtown Chicago last night, and I have to say it was not at all worth the $80 I spent for it. It's convenience to downtown is, really, it's only plus. Once we got into our room, I realized we were right beside train tracks, which were loud. Also, the lights and air conditioner in our room didn't work. Only one outlet worked in the entire room, which had a deck light and the TV plugged into it. We sweated all night long, because it was so hot, the trains were loud, and the pillows were like the pillows you get at camp (plastic ones with a pillowcase). I woke up with my neck hurting, and having slept terribly. I would not recommend anyone stay here. Pay a few extra bucks and get a nice room somewhere elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “not that bad”
Reviews.Author: CLERK34
Reviews.Content: the hotel was not that bad, if you want to stay downtown and looking to save on money. You get what you pay for, and don't expect more. The hotel did have a slight smell, but it is a old building and close to water, which is expected. Hotel is in walking distance to Grant Park and Sears Tower, which is what I wanted. Therefore the hotel was just fine for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Bluesfest”
Reviews.Author: poolmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Bluesfest and it more than fit our needs. We were able to take the train right from the O'Hare airport, then a 6$ cab fare to hotel. The staff were very friendly and gave us lots of information about the area. Thank you to Woody our friendly/funny maintence man. Bluesfest was a short walk away and the continental breakfast meant we didn't have to make coffee in the room. We did have a small fridge and coffee maker. The shower worked fine and the beds were comfortable for one(only doubles). Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “IDEAL DOWNTOWN LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Bugerov
Reviews.Content: The travelodge is in a pretty good location in downtown Chicago: within a few minutes of the EL, a 20 minute walk from the Magnificent Mile (shopping), about 5-10 mins walk from Willis (Sears) Tower, and there are a number of restaraunts, bars and shops within 5 mins walk. In terms of the 'loop' it's located in the SouthEast corner! If you use the train from O'Hare it'll take about 45 mins, followed by a further 15 mins on foot. Going by road would probably be quicker. We booked the Travelodge Downtown because it was inexpensive (about Â£80 per night) and we intended to use it to sleep in and that's it! There's too much to do in Chicago in two days to spend our time in the hotel. I'll point out now, this is a downtown 2/3 star hotel and it operates and is furnished accordingly.
