If you want the luxuries associated with 4/5 star hotels, you'll need to book a 4/5 star hotel and pay a 4/5 star price. Nevertheless, the room and remainder of the hotel were clean and comfortable. One of the elevators was broken with no idea as to when it will be fixed, but there's still 2 other elevators to use and the staircase was working fine. The complimentary breakfast included as part of the deal was served from a diner, which is an adjoining building. In fact you don't even have to walk outside to access it. The food was pretty much the same as you'd be served in most downtown cafe/diners, nothing special. We found the staff to be very helpful: offering advice on what to do in the local area and they often had a flier that will get you a discount for that activity. In sum, you get what you pay for - a 2/3 star downtown hotel, but it is clean and comfortable with helpful staff. I suppose it depends on what you want out of the hotel: If you want a modern decor, up-market hotel with 4 star amenities, you need to look elsewhere. However, if like us, you don't require such luxuries and require a clean, well-located, cost-effective hotel which you'll use as somewhere to rest your head at night, the Travelodge Downtown Chicago is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: IdrivealotMaine
Reviews.Content: It is an older hotel. The elevated train turns right close by and runs often - so, you do hear it. It is really kind of a neat place, though. If you want luxury, might want to check someplace else. If you want something nice that has an old Chicago feel to it. You might like this place. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheep for a reason”
Reviews.Author: Katy24_10
Reviews.Content: Likes: -Cheep -Close to downtown -Remodeled bathroom -Close to an el station Dislikes: -Cleaning staff is loud -Ran out of toilet paper and there is no backup in the room -Shampoo in room feels like hand soap and there is no conditioner -Front desk staff could be nicer -The hotel ran out of extra pillows -Only one elevator worked -Parking is not attached to hotel and costs $28 per night (3pm and later is considered another night) -Website says "Complimentary Continental Breakfast" but never heard a word about it at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: 9oaks
Reviews.Content: We were booked in the Congress Hotel a few blocks away and changed at the last minute because of a strike of Congress Hotel workers. Everything was booked except the Travelodge. I know why: the carpet was filthy, the desk chair had incomprehensibly disgusting stains, and the windows were so sooty they completely blocked the sun. Our friends decided to keep their reservation at the Congress - and were very pleased with the cleanliness of the hotel and their room. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: honestperson27
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff is extremely rude, and the manager is no better. The guy who checked us in gave false information and tried to over charge.The female who works there(name unknown) should be FIRED. We tried to ask her several questions,but she quickly let us know she had other things to do. Also, The hotel is not in loop of things like people might think. To get to the heart of the action you have to walks several blocks. Oh, and once you get back your key wont work.

Reviews.Title: “Total dump. Only pluses are location and price”
Reviews.Author: jamesteroh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend. He got the hotel price. I was skeptical when he told me how cheap he got a loop hotel for and I saw why the second I walked into the room. The location is great but that is it. The hotel was a total dump and VERY outdated. The room had a musty smell . Luckilly we were there for a party Saturday night and did tourist stuff during the day Saturday and I flew in Friday night late and left Sunday morning so I was only in the room long enough to sleep. I wish we would have spent a little mroe and stayed at a nicer property in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not the ritz but good enough....”
Reviews.Author: billybobthorthan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not elegant or plush, the staff are not friendly or very helpful but the location is amazing and the rooms although very dated are clean and surprisingly roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But ...”
Reviews.Author: luke47
Reviews.Content: The location is great, but after that, it's all downhill. It's an old, tired hotel with a loud window A/C unit, a heater that can't be turned off, old TV with a remote that didn't work, no hair dryer, and old furniture. The bathroom had been renovated so it was fine. There is a computer in the lobby, but you have to pay to use it. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I'm sure that they are used to hearing the same complaints. If you are looking for a CHEAP hotel with a GREAT LOCATION in CHICAGO - this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free wifi, but very few amenities”
Reviews.Author: abutler5
Reviews.Content: Well when I booked this hotel I knew that it was not a luxury hotel. I was on a budget and liked the location. First I booked two double beds for my friend and I, but when I confirmed I was told I had "one cozy bed". The rooms are clean enough but really, really small, like smaller than a dorm room. We didn't have room for our two suitcases, they just had to lay open on the floor and we walked over them. The room was either really hot or really cold and the train and construction is loud so bring ear plugs. Don't expect a view! The worst part was the cleaning. We stayed five nights and our room was only cleaned two times, after we complained. We had to request cups and towels everyday. We ran out of toilet paper and they brought us a half used role! So if you must stay here, bring your own tp, cups, hairdryers, and don't expect a clean room every day! On the bight side, the wifi is free!

Reviews.Title: “Filthiest Hotel I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: JoJohn123
Reviews.Content: Wow. Where to begin? Don't be fooled by the relatively good location of this awful dump. I've been to more than 50 countries and stayed in some terrible places, but this was the worst. Bedbugs, unhelpful staff, putrid bathrooms, and the rattiest carpet you can imagine await you. My wife, son, and I arrived at midnight and checked in. When we got to the room we were horrified, but we were told there were no other rooms available. So we toughed it out, got up at 6:00, and started calling other hotels. By 10:00 am we were checked into a nearby Sheraton. No hedging here--DON'T stay in this place!

Reviews.Title: “On a budget? Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: podla
Reviews.Content: We booked through a cheap hotels website and was not disappointed, location is excellent, just a 10 min walk from Greyhound, right on the subway and Elevated train. Everything you want to see is within walking distance, all very safe. It was clean and comfortable, the only downside is that we couldn't turn the heating off but there is air conditioning which solved that issue. This isn't a new building and don't expect wonderful glamour, it is downtown and not silent. Just stay here and enjoy Chicago without paying through the nose to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “They were dishonest with my payment for accommodation”
Reviews.Author: RielCapeTown
Reviews.Content: I booked this room on Travelocity and prepaid for my accommodation. Despite the fact that I had printed proof of the fact that I had paid in full, on checking out the clerk at the front desk demanded another payment. He was not interested in the proof of payment I produced and would not let us go without paying again. Because we had a flight to catch and there was a burly security guard standing threateningly next to us, I gave up arguing after a while and paid again. On returning home, I wrote the hotel an e-mail telling them of our experience and requesting a refund. Despite their promised of refunding me, this has not happened yet. Furthermore, the hotel is noisy, with people carousing in the corridor keeping us awake at night. A very unpleasant experience; I would not recommend this hotel at all. Riel Hauman Cape Town, South Africa

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but well situated”
Reviews.Author: Ohio_Prof
Reviews.Content: If you are planning on staying on Michigan Avenue, this is a much better deal than the Hilton or the Congress. Although there is prestige in getting a Lake view, if you are here on business a hot shower and a clean bed are all you need. The Travelodge provides both for half the price of its next-door competitors. Each room has a minifridge, microwave, and coffeemaker. Most rooms have a separate sitting room/office area and bedroom area. There is free WiFi. This is what a business traveler needs. This hotel is NOT for tourists or children. If you are in Chicago on vacation, the loud El, the lack of a pool, and the homeless folks sitting next to the main door are likely to be off-putting. If you are here for work, it is ideal. Also, being less than 2 blocks from the El station is a little noisy, but extremely convenient for getting out to Midway or O'Hare.

Reviews.Title: “cheap place to stay - here The Loop”
Reviews.Author: asraehl
Reviews.Content: I got a nice Kingsize Bed which was really cosy. one negative topic is the soud of the metro next to the hotel, or the noise of shjowering people from the level above or below

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: downstateburnie
Reviews.Content: I had to attend a convention in Chicago and couldn't afford the conference hotel (Palmer House) and so booked rooms at the Travelodge. I was expecting the worst (I've stayed in some NASTY Travelodges before), but the location and price were excellent so I figured I'd take a chance. First of all, the front desk staff was so nice - I wanted to check in early so I could attend some meetings at the conference, and they didn't even blink (most hotels try to make you feel bad for not waiting until 3). The room was quite large, bright, clean and cheerful and the bed was really comfortable. There are two restaurants downstairs - the little diner was perfect for a quick breakfast or lunch (and surprisingly inexpensive) and the Thai place was fabulous. Every hotel staff member I spoke with was friendly and chatty (especially the maintenance guy - I needed help with the in-room safe and he took care of everything quickly!). My only complaint is that their cable menu is missing some obvious channels (Weather, Comedy Central), but no one should be watching TV when there's the whole city to explore. Speaking of exploration - the Art Institute is just up the block and the hotel is also a block from the shopping on Michigan and State Streets, so everything is really convenient. Altogether, the hotel is old and not nearly as nice as the Palmer House, but it was so inexpensive and much better than I expected. Would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: SoloTraveller3
Reviews.Content: Very close to the Loop. Furniture is a bit dated, but comfortable. Great free wireless internet in rooms. Very nice Thai restaurant in the house, or a cheapy fast food place with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Cindertown
Reviews.Content: Good location right in the centre (The Loop).Bought Breakfast in adjoining diner,Well priced.Hotel a bit noisy due to being in The Loop and trains passing by all through the night but probably same everywhere.Good sized room.Value for money.Reception staff very knowledgeable and helpful.Hotel just around corner from Buddy Guys Blues Legends Club.Well worth a visit.Make sure to visit Field Museum,excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: packedlite
Reviews.Content: My daughter stayed here and brought home bedbugs. Check the mattress before staying here. I know bedbugs have become a serious problem in American hotels, but they are an expensive, aggravating and horrible problem when you get them in your house. The hotel offered her a free stay in their hotel as compensation! I am advising her not to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: hteVa
Reviews.Content: Travelodge downtown Chicago was very accomodating, the front desk was great with directions and any of our many questions. There were two restraunts, both were good to eat at and the Chicago carryout was pretty reasonably priced as well.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value”
Reviews.Author: mm1020
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at travelodge. This second time, we had a much nicer room with a city view. This hotel is for the budget minded because the carpeting is old and the furniture is dated, but the bathrooms are updated and well lit. I never felt the hotel was dirty, just worn. We've stayed at two of the hilton hotels in Chicago and though very pretty inside, I felt this location was better for us. I actually enjoyed the unpretentiousness of the hotel and attached restaurants and felt very much at home. I wish I could remember the name of the man who so helpful, helping us with our bicycles and luggage and warning us of the many marches going on when we took our bikes out. As for security, we left our door ajar one morning for only ten minutes before security was knocking to warn us. The mattresses during both visits were very comfortable. Though I'll admit the view of the alley on visit #1 was pretty dreary. I also like that we don't pay for swimming pools and excercise rooms we never use. I asked the maid for more coffee packets and she volunteered condiments? towels? anything else? We'llbe back, but if you're looking for the lap of luxury you will be dissapointed. By the way, the parking across the street is $28 night for cars, remember to have your pay stub validated. I believe this is a fair rate for Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but good value”
Reviews.Author: Norrbagge
Reviews.Content: This is one of very few low priced hotels in downtown Chicago. The rooms are rather worn and the furniture is dated, but you get a fridge and a micro. Beds are fine. Internet worked great. My only real critisism is the noisy elevated Red line which runs just outside. Don't expect to get much sleep if you're a light sleeper. I wasn't that bothered though.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!! We will be back.”
Reviews.Author: khowieSpringLake_MI
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with my mom and sister. We found the room to be clean with unexpected amenities such as a refridgerator and microwave. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially the bellman, Lester. He helped us get on the correct bus and helped us with our luggage. I can't wait to go back and stay in this hotel. It was centrally located to all main attractions and we felt safe there. We loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For The Money”
Reviews.Author: cjfriend1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to see Chicago and needed to be on a budget to afford everything else so we booked a week here. We had room 1235 (top story on end of building) so we didn't get a lot of noise all week. The staff at desk aren't very knowledgeable so just ask people on the street for advice/directions. Our room was pretty small but clean and we averaged $77/night including hotel tax. Try to get that anywhere in the loop!! Ice machines only on select floors (12th floor had one). Breakfast place downstairs was cheap for a quick starter meal. Bus stop on both east Congress and State street only blocks away as well as the underground portion of the "EL". Great location to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad-great value”
Reviews.Author: RCGUA
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 535, the room has one full size (single person) bed. I wanted a cheap room and I did not plan to spend any time in the room except to sleep. There is no view from the windows of room 535, just brick buildings across the narrow alleyway but I don't care, I'm not hanging around in the room anyway, it was more important to me that the location was right in the heart of downtown, very close to the "bean" art thing next to the lake. I did not hear a single sound from anyone in the hall or in the other rooms, nothing. The hotel is old and solidly built so the sound doesn't pass through the walls like newer Motel 6 type places. Some people might not like the "whoosh" of the El train but I liked it, it was like a white noise that subdued any other noises. Really, seriously, the sound of the train was no big deal, it was fine. The good thing about this place is that you can call the hotel directly in Chicago; you don't need to deal with the national reservations call center. I called the hotel and asked for a discount and they dropped the price of the room down to $67 dollars per night. Parking is $26 per night, the only cheaper parking downtown is $24 so the price for parking is great, and you can take your car in and out of the lot as much as you need to for no extra fee. And another hugely important reason that I chose this hotel was because there is no fee to change or cancel your reservations typically up to 4pm on the day of the reservation. You don't get locked into the rate like places like Hotwire or Orbitz or whatever.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate accomodations”
Reviews.Author: lindacul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while in town for Lollopalooza. For the purposes of this trip this hotel was fine. Convenience was very important since the concert was in grant park and this hotel was a mere 5 minute walk. We had an oversized room with two dbl beds, microwave, fridge, "minibar" area. Beds were comfortable, but certainly not anything special. Flimsy pillows. Small bath towels. Hotel is old and dated, but seemed well maintained for it's age. Bathroom was newly redone and very clean--just as seem in the photos on the website. I used to live in chicago the sound of the nearby train did not bother me, but we had earplugs just in case. There is a nice little restaurant downstairs with good, fast, inexpensive food (Chicago Carry-out). Service was very good--at check in and through out stay. My biggest complaine??? The elevators were sooooo slow. I know the hotel was sold out with festival goers, but the wait time for the elvators was painful. We were on the top floor and we could never get an elevator. In fact, when we were checking out we waited so long I called the front desk and asked for someone to come get us in the service elevator. They were kind enough to come get us--and we beat the full elevator that had stopped at our floor before we even called! In conclusion, you get what you pay for. The Travelodge is adequate if you need budget friendly accomodations (we paid $138/nt)in grant park area. However, I would not stay here if i was coming to chicago for a weekend that did not involve Lollapalooza.

Reviews.Title: “Great for college students”
Reviews.Author: talulu6
Reviews.Content: It's a cheap hotel, in a good location (next to the subway), the room was clean. Great if you dont want to spend too much money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Good service. Good Price.”
Reviews.Author: amoeba19
Reviews.Content: Extremely good location for using the subway and buses, which allows us to go to all places that we wanted to see in Chicago. There's a Thai restaurant next to the hotel- food wasn't bad. Pizza hut, KFC, Subway and Dunkin Donuts are just round the corner. Other restaurants, CVS, grocery stores etc could be found nearby too. It's within walking distance to go to the parks and Michigan Ave. from the hotel. Free coffee/tea per person per day. BEST: online check-in and print boarding pass for free using their computer at the lobby (I'm impressed). Luggage storage upon checking-out: $1 per bag. Parking is not free. Taking the subway from hotel is the most convenient way esp. weekends when there are special events and some streets are closed.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for...”
Reviews.Author: meenak621
Reviews.Content: It's the cheapest you can find in downtown, so don't expect too much. Coming from the south, I hated paying so much for a room that wasn't too great. Bathroom was redone and nice. Rooms felt somewhat dark and dingy. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good”
Reviews.Author: chukafa007
Reviews.Content: A Real Gem. The hotel is excellent - Good, Big Rooms, Clean Bathroom with a Bath Tub, Near to Public transportations. The staff was excellent. room cleaning was good. room had coffee makers, free local calls, iron with board etc. The restaurant down below was also very good. You cross the street and you get Subway, KFC, Dunking Donuts all in a line. Really avery good hotel - willing to go back if Chicago is once again a destination.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Mango001
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and chose it due to it's central location and good rates compared to other hotels in the area. The location is brilliant, and as long as you don't expect too much from a budget hotel, it's fine. Our room was basic and a bit shabby, but clean. It was very noisy due to the L train right outside, I don't think you could stay for more than a few nights unless you can sleep through a lot of noise! The hotel seemed secure enough but I agree with other reviewers that I might not stay on my own as a female, just because there were often a few people around the outside of the hotel at night. I think if you're in a couple or a group it wouldn't be an issue. Overall, good value for money given how easy it is to get around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Really wasn't bad at all! HUGE and CLEAN room! Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust_0517
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Travelodge Chicago Downtown this past weekend with two girlfriends. We wanted a cheap hotel in a decent location. This hotel has both! We never expected this hotel to be 5 Stars, and it wasn't, but we were pleasantly surprised! The main thing we were hoping was that the hotel would be CLEAN and we would feel safe. The outside, lobby, elevators, and hallways were all clean. Everyone who worked there and who were staying there were very friendly. Most other patrons of the hotel are young budget travelers like us. We were on the 6th floor, room 605 I think. Our room was HUGE. We had two double beds, which were across from each other in the long room. Two windows, a TV, an upholstered chair and desk, even a kitchenette! We never used it but it appeared very clean. Our bathroom was spotless! We had plenty of clean towels and soaps etc. The bathroom actually seemed like it may have been updated recently. The hotel smelled like a hotel but it wasn't a noticeable stench or anything. The carpets didn't appear stained or dirty (though I did wear my shoes in the room as a precaution), nor did the blankets or the walls. The room had two large closets, one with a safe, which I would recommend using if you were planning on leaving anything important in the room. Overall we felt the experience was just fine! I've stayed the night in friends apartments that were WAY nastier than this place. I will say that I probably wouldn't have stayed in this hotel alone as a young woman, but our group of three women felt perfectly fine together in this hotel as a group. One bit of advice: If you are a light sleeper, take a sleeping pill or ear plugs because the elevated train is catty corner from the hotel, and there were a few car alarms going off in the night. If you want a pretty decent location to stay in Chicago for a night or two, the Travelodge is a perfectly fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not the WORST place in the world”
Reviews.Author: Weezebean
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviews that says it is loud. The train literally runs about 100 feet from the building. But I think that is mostly because the windows are REALLY old and you hear all the noise coming in from them. By "newly remodeled" they mean Paint Coat number 862 on the walls, poorly applied I might add. Talking to them on the phone is just about pointless. I called twice and both times seemed like I was just bothering them. In person they were much friendlier. The bellman was quite nice actually. Of course housekeeping was knocking on my door starting at 8am to clean the room, which was kind of annoying every half hour... I would not recommend this hotel if you have any allergies, especially to dust. My room really could have used a thorough cleaning, but it was livable for one night. I did not have any bed bug issues, so that was good. The bathroom smelled of stagnent water, which I believe was the shower curtain. The tub was REALLY deep. Had the tub been clean, I definately would have relaxed in a hot bath, but there was slight coat of scum on it, so I decided to NOT be a human scouring pad. But, I guess in comparison to other rates in the area, it was cheap. If you are looking for a hotel experience, this is definately not your place. If all you need is a bed to sleep in for a few hours and a hot shower, you should be fine. Just bring a pair of earlplugs unless you are a really sound sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down Hotel - Decent Price - Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: Beast_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid April 2009 and got a very good rate through a 3rd party website. The Hotel looked to me like it was the first Travelodge ever made! The place is in desperate need of a refurbishment. The Room was fairly small but dirty and dark. The carpets were once red but now almost black with worn patches and stains. The bed had obviously had its fair share of sleepers and was in need of changing. The noise from the streets was so loud I was continuously waking up throughout the night. I do believe though that with a complete refit this hotel would be a nice place to stay. Itâ€™s within walking distance of Grant Park, The Navy Pier and the Sears Towers. In the lobby there is a great value breakfast bar / cafe which I believe is independently owned, which we went to every morning for breakfast sandwiches. I would only stay here if you are on a budget and need a hotel in which you just lay your head down for the night.

Reviews.Title: “It looked like high crimes were committed in my room”
Reviews.Author: Clevelandchic
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was close to the office and reasonably priced. MISTAKE. The front desk seemed uninterested that we had arrived and in a hurry to get back to their chit chatting. The room was like a jail cell. It was small, cramped and dirty. The couch in the room was COVERED in stains of god knows what and I refused to go near it. It was the kind of room where yo9u use a tissue to change the channel on the TV. The bed was the most uncomfortable thing I have ever slept on. We kept looking under the covers at the bed itself because we were certain we were just going to see planks of wood. My boyfriend and I would have been on the couch in a second if it wasn't so filthy.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! I lost money, credit card, passport & ticket in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Galagirl
Reviews.Content: My friend whom we were visiting in Chicago booked us in this hotel last April 12-13. I won't complain about the dirty carpets and leftover tissues but about the security in this hotel. This hotel has NONE!! When we came back to the hotel the evening of April 12 from a day of touring the city, we saw that there was no complimentary water so we went down to 711 to buy some. Since it was already 10pm, we thought it would be safe to leave my envelope containing my credit cards, passport, some money and plane ticket in the night stand's drawer than carry it with us outside and we would be gone for only a little while. We were out for about 45 minutes. When we went out of the room, I noticed there were young people outside our room in the corridor hanging out. I thought they were tourists like us. Now I am beginning to think otherwise. The next day, we checked out at 11 am. Before we left I checked the drawer but only the bible was there so I thought my companion already retrieved the envelope because she was the one packing our things. I was busy working on my laptop. When we reached Cleveland, we found out that the envolope was missing and my friend said she did not take it out of the drawer and she thought I took because I was working on the table. We called the hotel immediately but the front desk said we had to wait until 8 am to be able to speak to the housekeeping or to check the room because only himself and the doorman are in the hotel. There were no emergency number to reach anyone who could answer our questions. When asked if somebody checked-in after we checked-out, he said yes. The next morning when we called again, the day staff said nobody used the room after we checked out and they will check out the room and call us back. They called us back once to say they did not find anything but I said it should be there as we are very sure and where else would it go and there's money and credit cards in it. Hearing there were money there, he said they will investigate and call us back. They never called us back again and we made several calls, got connected to the manager's office and was answered by machines. So we drove back to Chicago early the next day from Cleveland for 6 hours. We looked for the manager and he met us in the lobby and he was very rude and unaccommodating. He would not even listen and entertain the possibility that my valuables have been stolen from the room. The first thing he said when he met us is that we are free to file a police report about the loss. He ordered my brother in law to leave when he suggested the valuables might have been stolen. He only wanted to believe that we misplaced it somewhere. But we are very sure that we did not. I thought my brother in law and the manager would end up in a fight because the manager was short of pushing my brother in law out because he suggested that my valuables could have been stolen. My sister and I had to stand between the two of them while my brother in law was telling the manager, " Don't you lay your hands on me!" Seeing the hostilty, we left. We did not come for a confrontation but with a hope of finding even just my passport so I can fly back to the philippines the next day. We spent the rest of the day at the Consulate to secure Travel documents to facilitate my travel without a passport. So fellow travelers, if you don't want any trouble, STAY AWAY from this hotel!!! There are other hotels with relatively the same price but much cleaner and safer than Travelodge. The hotel has no security at all! They have no security cameras in corridor nor staff in the lobby at night other than the doorman and 1 receptionist. if your room is flooding at night, you'll have to wait until the next morning before somebody fix it, if they will. We learned a painful lesson. Never take your valuables off your body and NEVER EXPECT A HOTEL TRAVELODGE IN CHICAGO TO CARE about what happen to them.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all. No bugs.”
Reviews.Author: LilITNYC
Reviews.Content: I was aprehensive at first because of a review that I had read. I must say though that I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is dated and looks like a budget hotel. But it is comfortable, clean and the staff is friendly. I live in New York City and know that there are issues w/ pests in this day and age of green chemicals. And not a week goes by that I don't hear about some hotel in NY having some kind of issue. I did not find any reason to fear here. The beds are comfy, the location is great, and as I mentioned the staff is nice. This is all that I look for in a hotel. So I'm sure there are times that others will have issues, but who knows how their days went anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and poor service”
Reviews.Author: diamond_6irl
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 long days. It was my fist time in Chicago and wanted a close hotel to the main attractions so i decided to go for this hotel because it was cheap and well located. I arrived there with the flu and not feeling that good so i just wanted to get some rest and take a shower. My key didnt work properly the first time and went to look for some help. Well nobody could help me because there were nobody at the front desk. I went back to my room to the 5th floor still carrying my luggage! I found out this guy having a conversation with someone. Instead of being there to help. He just opened me the door. The room decoration was old and needed some paint and maintenance. Is like your back in the 90's. The room smelled funny because you cant open the windows. The bathroom was very simple but thank God clean even though they left the same toilet paper that probably someone else used. There was in the trash a used tissue next to my bed which gave me the idea that they dont clean that often. The tv wasnt working properly and i could only watch 4 channels, the remote didnt even work so i had to get up and change the chanel every single time. The only good thing of the room was that the bed was very comfy and clean so i slept kind of good until the train started to operate at early morning. One of the maids were too loud! She was laughing so loud like she didnt care that there were people trying to sleep! Oh! and there was a construction at the corner of the hotel! I was sick and just wanted a little bit of peace. On my second day I went shopping and when i got back my key didnt work again so i went back to the 1st floor so they could change it. My bed wasnt even made and my trash was still there. The elevator almost got stuck while 2 guys and me were on there. Their internet acess is poorly. They dont really have a good signal all over the room. The day of my check out i called the front desk to let them know i wanted to check out earlier and they said yes no problem so when i went down to check out the guy there said i would have to wait because 'he was busy doing things' and i had a flight to phx so couldnt wait for him to be ready to help me. He said that he will fax my bills and still havent received anything yet. If you dont care too much about sleeping then this hotel could work for you. I would say spend a little bit more and have a quality treatment. The only good thing is the location. Grant Park is right around the corner. Also the Magnificent Mile and Millenium Park, but i would definetely say go for another option.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel, Use in case of emergency.”
Reviews.Author: sebawhite
Reviews.Content: Smells really bad. Like an Indian restaurant. The rooms are big and bed are confortable. Good location and easy to get. Just for an emergency night.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Price not the rooms”
Reviews.Author: jmc325
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a long weekend trip with friend to see the city and a Bears game. The hotel is about 200 yards from Grant park. In Grant park you can walk to the North end to Millennium Park, in the Middle is the art museum and the far end the planetarium, history museum and finally Soldierâ€™s Field. We walked to the game in less than 15 minutes. There are affordable cab rides to the magnificent mile, Rush St., or the Sears tower. The rooms them self are nothing special but the staff at the desk were friendly and could make some good recommendations of where to go. For what I paid and what I expect it was great, but for what the place is ... not that nice but everything you need and a great location for everything you want to see.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the bed bugs...”
Reviews.Author: wisetraveler84
Reviews.Content: Don't be deceived by this hotel's affordable rates and great location. Our room was not cleaned very well--there was an imprint of an iron in the rug on our carpet. I've never seen anything like that. But wait--there's more! The hotel is infested with bed bugs! My brother and I stayed for one night in June, 2008, and left with 30+ bites on our bodies. We went to a doctor upon returning home and he diagnosed the bites as being from bed bugs. It was disgusting! I called the manager (Mr. Minas Gorguis) to complain. He even indicated that they'd had bed bugs one month prior to our stay. I demanded my money back for that night's stay, but he refused to do so. He actually had the audacity to invite us back to stay another night, but there was no chance that we were going to do that, since we did not want to take the chance and get bitten by more bed bugs!! This was absolutely by far the WORST hotel I have ever stayed at!!!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!! I have traveled extensively, all over the world, and have stayed in many different hotels. I will NEVER stay at a Travelodge again, and most definitely WILL NOT stay at the Travelodge in Chicago. We complained to the Better Business Bureau, and are seriously considering pursuing litigation against Travelodge. Pay a little bit more, and stay at a nicer hotel in the area. I posted my review here because Mr. Gorguis has not assured us that they have taken the necessary precautions to ensure that this does not happen again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - I'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: Easty-AU
Reviews.Content: I visited Chicago for two days on a backpacker's budget so was looking for something cheap but tidy and close to the city. The Travelodge delivered on all my requirements. Some reviews I'd read on this site complained about noise from the street and nearby L train. I had a room facing the main street and had no problems. Staff were friendly and provided local info on best attractions/bars/restaurants etc. For those travelling without a laptop there is a guest computer in the foyer that provides free internet access. The room was clean, bed freshly made and the shower hot - all I required from my base while I explored the city. There is a Dunkin' Donuts and Subway 2 min walk away, a restaurant in the foyer and plenty of food outlets nearby. The nearest subway station - Harrison (red line) is a block from the hotel (for travel to O'Hare airport travel one station to Jackson and transfer to the blue line train). The L Train is a three block walk and will get you around the inner city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and price for chicago”
Reviews.Author: janesta
Reviews.Content: Good for travelers on a budget, wanting no frills. Easy access to Grant/millenium Parks. Walking distance to Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient for the purpose”
Reviews.Author: Callowild
Reviews.Content: -Recently stayed at the Travelodge for the RSNA convention at McCormick Place. Many of the reviews are spot on - The rooms are clean, albeit dated, the staff is friendly and the location is great - but bring your ear plugs if your room faces the train tacks. It's pretty brutal. The HVAC was a bit of a mystery but I found the right mix of heat and coolness. The convenience factor offsets the other distractions and the place will suffice for a night or two. The WiFi worked fine and it is truly free. I'll call this one a tie between the economic gain and the comfort factor.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Quest715
Reviews.Content: We came in from the Chicago Suburbs for an activity in the city. The hotel was just fine for 4 of us. We appreciated the room safe. Our room was in the back by the alley, but inspite of reviews that this was a bad location, it was actually quiet and probably better than the side with the "L" going by all the time. A Panera is only a block north and west, so breakfast was easy to take care of. Subway is across the street for a quick lunch, and lots of more eating choices of all prices are within walking distance. Hotel a bit tired. The staff was nice. Room clean. We were on the third floor so walked up and down as the elevators were a bit slow in showing up. We did not use parking as we used public transportation in and out of the city. Overall I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: wizzy1952
Reviews.Content: Although I was not sure what to expect for the price, we found the TravelLodge a nice place to stay. Yes, it is older but it was clean and served our needs. The staff was friendly and well informed on the easy way to get to the sites. We did have to ask for a hair dryer and toothpaste at the desk and they gladly provided it. The 2 resturants connected to the lobby were good. One was Thai I believe and the other was a breakfast to dinner joint. It had a lot of choices to pick from on the menu. The hotel is close to a lot of major sites. The L that runs by is quite noisy but we didn't notice after we fell asleep. We would leave by 9:00am and not return untill 9-10PM, so as much time as we spent in the room, the price was right. We stayed 3 days, 2 nights and they held our baggage for us until our rooms were ready and until our train left which gave us extra time to roam the city without draging our bags around. The next time I am in Chicago, this will be the first place I would check out. The price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ale56
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good if you want to save money being in a very central location in Chicago. You are just few steps from Grant Park and from the subway stops in theLoop. The forniture and the internal aspect of the hotel are old-fashion and not fancy at all. Anyway you have a 30'' TV and free Wi-Fi connection. The bathroom could be more clean (in the angles you can find dirty) but overall it is ok. I didn't find the hotel noisy though my window was on the side that looks on the "L" train tracks.

Reviews.Title: “Location okay, but bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: Essellanden
Reviews.Content: Let me start with a couple of positive notes on this hotel. For the Chicago Loop location, it's relatively cheap. The red line subway and the buses are just 1 or 2 blocks away . The rooms are quite large and the view is nice. Now come the bad parts: The EL train tracks are across the street. The passing trains create considerable noise, and as they run from 05:00 AM to 01:00 AM, earplugs are a necessity for a good night's sleep. It's an old building. The doors jam and the locks are not in good condition. I had to jiggle the front and bathroom door to get them open and shut. Walking down the hallway one morning, we heard someone who got locked inside the room because the front door wouldn't open. All in all a reasonable choise, but if you like a room with a view, bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel in Great Downtown Chicago Location”
Reviews.Author: Susyn
Reviews.Content: I wanted a hotel right in the downtown of Chicago as close to Lake Michigan and Grant Park as possible, because I wanted to be near everything I wanted to see. Most of the hotels in this area were extremely expensive and not affordable, except for the Travelodge Downtown Hotel. It is located just two blocks from Grant Park and just one block from the Chicago Transit Authority Red Line stop. I found their best rate online for AAA and AARP discounts, then called them and asked them if they could do better. They could -- they gave me 15% off the AARP rate! If you fly into O'Hare Airport, you take the CTA Blue Line train to the Jackson stop, then walk three blocks east to Wabash Street and, under the elevated train tracks overhead, walk another three blocks south to Harrison Street. The Travelodge is located at the southeast corner of Wabash and Harrison Streets. There is parking available in a parking garage behind the hotel which costs about $29 per day with the hotel discount, or you can park across the street in an uncovered private parking lot for $13 per day. The hotel is not the sort of hotel a business traveler would use, from what I saw of its amenities but it is perfect for budget travelers. A real plus for me is that it offers free wi-fi that you can access from your room. The rooms are drab, but the linens and towels, etc. seemed to be in good shape, although not of a high quality. A negative is that the rooms are VERY NOISY from outside noise. The hotel fronts the street and the back of it which has a t-shape either faces the parking garage or a busy alley that runs behind other big hotels and restaurants. Dump trucks went through the alley all night long emptying out dumpsters -- the noise echoed through the alley and literally made the room vibrate inside. I bought earplugs for the second night and the dumpsters being emptied still woke me up -- I could feel the concussion through my pillow! That was a real negative for me. The rooms have color TVs with local channels and HBO and Showtime for free, and some PPV channels -- it was about a 19-inch. There are no desks in the rooms from which to write if you are here on business travel. There is an ATM machine in the lobby. There is a Thai restaurant on the ground floor of the hotel and a small eat-in/takeout place on the other side of the hotel ground floor that opens at 6:30 AM is offers economical morning and afternoon meals. Subway and Pizza Hut were across the street and a 7-Eleven was two blocks away. The front desk clerk was somewhat grumpy when I checked in and a separate front desk clerk was harried and grumpy when I checked out, but the bell captain was very helpful when I asked for information on the best buses and subways to take to attractions. The rooms have free voicemail and if you need to receive a fax, the hotel does not charge to receive them, but they do charge to send them -- most hotels charge to receive them, so that was nice. The elevators all seemed to work (but don't look in the mirrors inside the elevators -- they were like carnival mirrors, everyone looks squat and wide in them). If I came back to Chicago on business, I would stay somewhere else (because my company would be paying) but if I came back myself on leisure, I would stay here again, except I would try to make sure I didn't get a room that faced the alley -- I think the rooms facing the street would have been quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad really”
Reviews.Author: latinboy1976
Reviews.Content: Ok, for anyone about to stay at this hotel you really need to lower your expectations. First this is not a 5 star hotel. Ok? This is at most a 2 star hotel but don't let that stop you from booking or staying here. I found the front desk folk to be quite nice. When we first went to check in our room wasn't ready. No biggie since it was about 11am and I wasn't expecting it to be ready. We dropped off our bags and came back a few hours later. Still the room wasn't ready and since it wasn't the lady upgraded us to a suite. Now if this happens to you don't get too excited. With the suite you get a fridge, a microwave and a sink along with a living room type deal. I will admit though that it was nice to have the extra space. I found the room upon checking in to be clean, the pillows to be slightly better then most 2 star hotels and from what the mister says the bed was comfy. For him to say the bed is comfy he is telling the truth since he has a lot of back issues. For me well a bed is a bed, I can sleep on almost anything. As for the location of the hotel well it is a bit of a distance to most anything but the location I would say is a safe one. There is a 24 hour Dunkin Doughnuts about a block away and the red line is a couple blocks away so that was nice. Now the question. Would I stay here again? Hmmm well maybe only if the Ohio House is full or I couldn't get a good rate at the Days Inn over in Lincoln Park. But I think my travels to Chicago are about over since in 6 months I will be moving out there and making the wonderful windy city my home :) I heart you Chitown!

Reviews.Title: “nice & close - but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: CourtneyLO
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went to Chicago for Lollapalooza, from July 31 to August 4, 2008. Location was key, we wanted to be walking distance to most attractions. The hotel was maybe a 15 min walk to Grant Park, 10 min to Millennium Park. We took a taxi to Navy Pier & Shedd Aquarium, it was only $7 each. There is a Dunkin Donuts, KFC, Pizzahut, Subway... all at the corner of the hotel, very convenient. When we checked in, went up to our room, the key did not work, we kept trying & then a guy opened the door! We made our reservation (for a single double bed room) 2 months in advance, so were we really annoyed thinking they had double booked the room... but they upgraded us to a king bed room at no additional charge. The bed was comfortable, but the room & bathroom were so small. The water pressure was weak & no hot water a few times. The hotel was very old, not the nicest hotel I've stayed at, but we knew that going in... we found the photos posted here helpful & similar to our room. Overall, this hotel is very expensive for what you get ($139/night for a double bed room & $32/day to park our small SUV), but the location was great. Stay here if close location to Parks & shopping is what you're after!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price, great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Elvin16
Reviews.Content: Very clean, close to all subways and buses. Very nice people!!! I will stay in this hotel my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Hated this place!”
Reviews.Author: notte
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotel experiences of my life. I (mom) was in Chicago with my adult son and had booked a room with 2 double beds. Instead we got a room with a King bed and were told there were no other rooms available. When I asked for a cot, none of those were available either. When I asked to speak to the manager, he was also unavailable. After I became angry, the desk clerk gave my son another room and assured me that we would not be charged for it. He also assured me that they could change our room to one with 2 beds in the morning and that I could speak to the manager in the morning. The room my son got stunk of cigarettes, despite the fact that the hotel is advertised as being totally non-smoking, and when he turned on the air conditioner, it tripped a circuit and so he had no electrical power for the night. My room lacked many of the usual amenities found in a standard hotel room such as tissues and phone book. When I called the desk to get some, the "security" guy brought them up. In addition, I could not figure out how to work the TV even after talking to the desk, and AGAIN, they sent up the "security" guy to help me. He had to read his handwritten directions to figure out the TV. There were no directions in the room on how to use the TV. We decided to check out in the morning and find another hotel. When we checked out, I asked for the manager once again, but he was not on the premises and I was told he was not coming in that day. My advice is DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL. The hostel would probably be better and cheaper. The good news is that we found a great hotel for the second night we were in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: lbo80
Reviews.Content: Service at the Travelodge Downtown is really terrible. The three front desk staff we encountered were all unhelpful and disorganised. The first lady could not find our reservation, and told us to come back later. She told us though they had plenty of rooms "none were clean yet" and to come back after 3.30. When we returned our reservation had been cancelled because it was 4.15 and all reservations are cancelled at 4pm. The third person we encountered was downright rude, and tried to charge us $130 when the reservation rate was only $85. We were not intimidated by his attitude however, and assured him we would only be paying what was agreed when we checked in and not what he wanted to charge us when we checked out. This is despite his claim that "the rate fluctuates". The cleaner also came into clean duly ignoring the "Do Not Disturb Sign" on the door. Rooms are shabby and noisy. The corridors are dark and dingy. Not all amenities in good order: coffee maker, phone, tv and lamp were broken. The air freshener smell is also overwhelming - not sure what it is meant to conceal. Location is far from the Mag Mile, but this is the least of your worries if you stay here - you'll be glad to be as far away from the hotel as possible. Single females may also find the hotel a bit scary. Note to UK readers: this hotel is not owned or operated by Travelodge UK and is of a much lower standard.

Reviews.Title: “Worth The Price”
Reviews.Author: thereandbackagain_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing special. It does have a great location though it's closer to the museum campus than Magnificent Mile. The walk wasn't too terrible but it was a good location. The hotel itself has two restraunts attached a sushi and then a hamburger place. Our room was very large and set up in the old style (the hotel was built in the 20's) The builing was older but that gave it some of its charm. The sink in our kitchenette didn't work and our t.v. only got 1 channel. But we were never in our room. The hotel staff was friendly and accomadating. For a trip to chicago where you'll never be in your room except to sleep this hotel accomodates the explorer. We weren't leaving until 3 in the afternoon and we had to check out at 11 but the hotel offered a bag check were you could check your bags in go out and about and come back for our stuff which was very convieniant. All in all the hotel offered the basic ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “It is like being in a Hopper painting - good mood required”
Reviews.Author: fmisa
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago for a few days; my main objective was to see the exhibit on Edward Hopper at the Art Institute, for those who are not familiar, Hopper is famous for his portrayal of depressed people in a 50's urban setting. Staying at the Travelodge turned out to be a very funny experience as the hotel has a strange Hopper feel. For instance, the personnel is helpful and polite, but everybody look soooo depressed; you can feel that those people hate their jobs and their lives. The hotel itself is very old, but clean. The whole decor is reminescent of a 1950's hotel, lot of gaudy carpeting everywhere. The room itself was OK. Unlike other reviews I read, the bathroom was just fine (but I have the feeling it may vary a lot from one room to the other). The furniture has seen better days. Lot of dents. The bed was uncomfortable at first, but then we quickly realized it had simply never been fliped. Once we did that, it was fine, it was in fact a good Serta mattress. And whoever did the last painting job inside the room should be fired as he did not bother protecting the furniture; the tv and bed had paint stains. The major problems are the very old windows, the close proximity to the elevated subway (see photo) and the antique air conditioninhg system, combined together, they make for a very noisy room (make sure to bring ear plugs as one other reviewer suggested - thanks for the tip by the way). But, on the other hand the insulation between rooms is great (all walls are concrete). There were kids on the next room but I never heard a noise (I have been to Hillton hotels where you could tell what TV program was playing next door). The view from the window is depressing (the train + a concrete parking ) but, I felt the location was perfect. I was one block away from Michigan avenue; and, I could walk to the lake and the museums. And if I wanted to go uptown I could take a bus on Michigan ave (there are buses every min - no kidding). We found the fast food restaurant very convenient. Once again it had a funny 50's feel. It is fast food all right, but we did not want to waist time in a restaurant, so it worked fine for us. One funny note: I found a good bottle of wine in downtown in Chicago, and I wanted to open it, but because of the new plane regulations I did have an opener with me. So I asked the concierge if he had one. He did have one but, explained, that because they got stolen all the time, I had to open my bottle on the spot in the main lobby. I thought the guy was joking; no, he was not. So I ended up opening my St Emilion in front of other guests. I laughed so much afterwards...... Overall, I am not sure I would go there again. I was in a good mood; and, I looked at the bright side of the whole thing thinking the experience was in tune with my love for Edward Hopper's work. I think next time I go to Chicago, I will go for a quieter hotel, possibly the Best Western which is close by. If I had to go again to the Travelodge, I would go for a double bed room; I took a peek, they are like small appartments with a kitchen sink, fridge and microwave, plus they are on the far side away from the subway. Otherwise, go for a room on the top floor, and don't hesitate to ask for naither room, if you are not happy. As I said before, I think there is great variation between rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on it!”
Reviews.Author: neurojun
Reviews.Content: It was terrible that I called them several times for claiming my lost clothing and charger for DC. They always ignored it by answering that "I will call you back if..." but nothing gonna happen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skibuddy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very enjoyable stay at the Travelodge in Downtown Chicago. After reading some of the posted comments I was really apprehensive about staying there, but decided to chance it anyways. We think most of the comments were unfounded. We did find the room and bathroom small or â€œKozyâ€� as they called it, but they were both very clean and the bathroom had been recently remodeled. We had a room with one double bed. The room was bright with nice pictures on the walls and the mattress and box springs were new â€œSerta Perfect Sleepersâ€�. The bed was very comfortable. There was plenty of hot water, and the towels were soft and clean. The hotel provided hand and body soap, shampoo, and body lotion. The TV worked well and had free HBO. The wireless internet worked great. (But donâ€™t forget to call the front desk to get the access code). The AC worked just fine and the coffee maker was new. There is no hairdryer so you want to bring your own, and like all downtown hotels it is noise. The El train runs all night and it is loud. There were fire, police, and ambulance sirens goings at all hours of the night, and we heard the sanitation men picking up garbage at 4:00am. Such is life in a big city. You may want to use ear plugs, or like us, use the â€œfan onlyâ€� on the AC to cover up the noise. We found that to work just fine. The halls were a bit narrow as all older hotels are, but they had recently been wall papered and they were well lighted. The ice machine had plenty of ice and we used it every day. We found the staff very friendly and checkout was quick and accurate. The price of the room was very reasonable for Chicago, but the $27 per day parking seemed high. I realize thatâ€™s the price you pay for being right down town. The vicinity was good with a Pizza Hut, KFC, and Dunkin Donuts right across the street. It was within walking distance of most things in downtown Chicago. The bell hop was very helpful and friendly. We did see a few homeless people and unfortunately all major cities have these people no matter where you stay. We saw them in front of the Hilton also which charges twice the price for a room. The price was great and we would stay there again. Our biggest complaint was that the hotel was older and the room was small, but we know that most downtown hotels in big cities are small. I guess itâ€™s all in how you see it. Some people see the â€œMona Lisaâ€� as an old picture while others see it as a work of art. Beauty is in the eyes of the beholder.

Reviews.Title: “alright for a quick trip, noisy and nothing speical”
Reviews.Author: acaciaruth
Reviews.Content: it was nicely located down town, half a block from the lake, and a $3. cab ride the the nice shoping areas and resturant. had the switch rooms when i got there. the windows were only partly covered by the unattractive curtians and there was a parking garage 6 feet away from the building... the bathrooms were all brand new and nice. def the best part of the hotel. bed was alright, nice to have kitchenet, tv half worked. staff wasnt very helpful or friendly over all. house keeping either took all the towels and washed them everyday-because they dont seem to follow the 'if its hanging you'll use it again' policy that they have posted everywhere. orrr iw as using towels that other peple had that they just fold up and put back on the rack...

Reviews.Title: “OMG!!!! What a Dunp!”
Reviews.Author: Shrimpboy
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through the Travelodge website. It was nothing like their pictures on the web. I arrived late at night and the attendant behind some one way glass (still visible) refused to wait on me because he was chatting up a young lady. Eventually the security guard bellowed at him and he came out. He gave me my key and went to the room an a rickety old elevator. I walked into the room and the bed was on end leaning against the wall with a construction wagon full of wire in the middle of the room. I went back to the front desk and after a 10 minute wait I was given another room. On the way I passed a number of holes in the plaster walls. This shabby room had no working TV. Again I was moved to another room. On the way to the room I could here a woman screaming at the top of her lungs. It sounded as if she was having fun but it shot through the paper thin walls. On my way to knock on her door the door opened and there was our friendly front desk clerk. Never again. It is just a horrible place.

Reviews.Title: “Never stayed here...”
Reviews.Author: amyaa
Reviews.Content: I live in Chicago and am looking for a hotel in the city for my relatives. I wouldn't even consider this hotel because I know it's within two or three blocks of the methadone clinic and a halfway house. I might be ok for driving and even walking around for certain people but others might feel very uncomfotable in this area.

Reviews.Title: “quaint”
Reviews.Author: spokybob
Reviews.Content: We visited Chicago by Amtrak on a limited budget to see the symphony and a basketball game. We had a great time and overlooked the negative things. We received a good value for the money. We might stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanQueen22
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with 5 other girls (all rooming in a room for 4 people). Our friends from Chicago booked the hotel and when we went to get another room the hotel was booked, so we just brought along an extra air matress. The hotel is very old, you can tell by the carpets, windows and fixtures. Not in a dingy way at all but this hotel has obviously been around a long time. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The room was spacious with 2 double beds, a small kitchenette including a fridge, an okay sized bathroom and 2 closets. The beds were comfy and the hotel was clean. There is a great breakfast place attached to the hotel that is cheap and very good. The best part of this hotel is the proximity to everything you want to see and do in the windy city. We could walk to all the stores and the shopping district, all the toursity sites like the Sears tower, and it was a short taxi drive to all the clubs. We took a trolley and did a pub crawl and this was so much fun!! I would recommend this anyone that wants to see a little of Chicago's night life and have a great time on the trolley. All in all I would recommend this hotel. Although it is an older hotel you cant go wrong with the location. One more thing, parking is valet parking and is across the street, this is $20 per night. I dont think I saw anything much cheaper in downtown Chicago. And Chicago is definetly the windy city!! Great time!

Reviews.Title: “OK downtown hotel, but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: bauernfeind
Reviews.Content: I was afraid of our stay at the travelodge because I booked nonrefundably via hotwire and looked at the mostly negative reviews afterwards. We are very frequent Chicago travellers (and former residents) and thought: -the hotel was clean and the furniture/fixtures at least acceptable, except for the other bed -the service was good (we needed service twice, once for our child accidentally locking the safe, they came very prompt; the other time for an information at the reception for which the internet was needed, also good and speedy help). -the neighborhood is in a borderzone between Michigan Ave and a neighborhood that is in the process of gentrification. One can complain about that, but the huge Hilton is just around the corner, and the hotel borders the loop. -there are 2 restaurants, one a fast food greasy spoon which also is the (mediocre) breakfast place, the other one a Thai place. -the hotel is quite noisy due to the combination of the elevated train nearby and the outdated windows. If they fixed the windows but stayed otherwise the same, we would return, but right now, it's just too noisy (and we had, as per reception, a "quiet room" facing the back).

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Worked for Us...”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisLisa
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge Downtown serves its purpose. We went to a Bears game and the hotel was convenient, cheaper than comparable hotels downtown (we paid $200 for 4 of us which is a heck of alot cheaper than a cab to the burbs a few times!) and fit the bill for what we needed. There are no luxury accommodations, valet or room service but hey, it's downtown and close to Soldier Field.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped”
Reviews.Author: betskuuk
Reviews.Content: Went on a driving holiday to USA and Canada and we just booked hotels as we went along. When we arrived in Chicago we found it very difficult to get accommodation as there was a conference on. All we could get was the travelodge. It was the dearest hotel we had to pay for out of the whole trip and the worst one we stayed it. The room was tiny and there were 4 of us in it. Usually in America the rooms are huge but this was the smallest i have stayed in. The location was okay but i would not go back unless i was desperate.

Reviews.Title: “hated it”
Reviews.Author: mzpaols
Reviews.Content: the only thing good about this hotel was the staff- its old and out dated, stink, dusty, and the rooms are very small - I would not recommend my dog to stary there

Reviews.Title: “Affordable basic accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: docmjc
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked this hotel to see a concert at the Auditorium Theater. We were only staying for one night and we wanted to be downtown near the venue, but did not want to spend a fortune for one night. We chose this hotel because it is less than a block from the theater, and, as it turned out, we could see the theater from our room. This hotel is budget priced for a downtown hotel. It is a bit on the minimalist side with the basic ammenities needed to be comfortable. We had a nice corner room with windows facing two directions. The room was cool and comfortable. The bed was soft for my tastes, but quite acceptable. The bathroom was small but adequate. Several of the ice machines were broken when we stayed and it was a bit difficult to find ice at times. Also there are only a few vending machines with very limited selections, so if you have snacking or beverage needs you will probably have to venture outside the hotel. In short, we werent expecting a luxury hotel. We wanted basic accomodations at a good price for one night. The travelodge was perfect for this. Im not sure that I would stay at this hotel if I were on vacation for a week and planned to spend significant time in the room. However, for basic accomodations for short stay such as a business trip or a quick get away to see the sights in Chicago, this place is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “basic and cheap”
Reviews.Author: vgardner
Reviews.Content: This is certainly the most affordable hotel I've stayed in in Chicago. My room was small but clean. The neighborhood is a bit dodgy but no more so than most other urban settings in the US. The Thai restuarant was fabulous. The location iis two blocks from the CTA Redline and quite close to Grant Park. The L-train on State Street was a bit loud, but the constant hum of the air conditioner mitigated the noise. It didn't keep me awake. I was there for business but wouldn't hesitate to bring my family back for a leisure trip. I would file this hotel under the general heading of "You get what you pay for."

Reviews.Title: “Old and begrimed -- but workable”
Reviews.Author: J13345
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have pointed out, the hotel looks old, feels old, and is more than a little begrimed. Everywhere you look, the carpets and curtains are faded and dingy appearing. The window in my room had a big old crack and was not exactly transparent. The AC unit was ungainly and loud; and thank goodness I didn't have to try to use the radiator. Also, though I was in a non-smoking room, I could distinctly smell cigarettes in my bathroom. On the plus side, there were no insects I could see, the bathroom was clean, and all the appliances in my room worked (though there were too few electrical outlets so that when it came to the desk lamp, the coffee maker, and the AC, you could only have 2 of the 3 at any given time). If noise pollution is an issue, then pay attention. I could hear my neighbors loud and clear including their t.v., their phone ringing, etc. However, I couldn't hear any pitter-patter from above. There must have been about a good 3/4 inch space between the bottom of the hallway door and the floor so that I could keep up on everything going on in the hallway and elevator. Also, from my north-facing room, there were the very insistent rumbles of the Orange Line trains and the sirens of Chicago's finest. You will finish the weekend with an appreciation of how much and how often the police and fire services are called upon. Clearly the major (if only) plus for this hotel is its location. It is located in what appears to be a safe neighborhood 1 block from the Harrison station of the CTA Red Line -- it took me about 50 minutes to get there from O'Hare via Blue Line transfer to Red Line at Jackson. The hotel is 1 block from Grant Park and is within easy walking distance from such tourist destinations as Art Institute of Chicago, Millenium Park, Carson Pirie Scott, etc. There is a Thai restaurant and a Chicago diner both adjacent to the lobby. Also, close by is a Dunkin Donuts and a Subways. Starbucks and so forth are only a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “The staff are great, hotel very average....”
Reviews.Author: ju123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chicago Travelodge Downtown for 4 nights as part of a 7 month long round the world trip. We booked via their website and were quoted just over $100+tax for a double room which we thought to be quite reasonable in a city such as Chicago. Arriving from Midway Airport on the train, the hotel is approximately 5 mins walk from the first station on the loop. It's a reasonable area, populated by a lot of students, so always felt very safe and the walk with luggage to the hotel was fine. When we arrived we were quite impressed by the reception area, although not modern, it was elegant and the staff were extremely friendly, especially with our credit card problems due to a cloning in Asia earlier in the trip. They did the extra security checks with no complaints and were very patient as it took about 30mins to sort out. As the room wasn't quite ready we checked our bags into storage and set off for a bite to eat. There are a number of fast food outlets just across the road including Dunkin Donuts. Once we were able to check in we headed up in the slowish lifts to our room. First problem, the double bed really was very small and with my Wife and I both being well over 6ft tall it was really no use to us. Therefore we rang down and asked to be moved to a king bed, which the staff sorted for us quickly, albeit for an extra $20 a night on top of the original price. The next room was better and slightly bigger with a good size king bed. We had no problems at all with the room, although I must admit the decor etc is a little dated. One problem that you might encounter is the banging pipes, this managed to keep my Wife awake for a while each night....not a lot you can do about that I guess. Location is great. Just down from the loop, plenty of restaurants and coffee shops in the local vicinity. We used the underground to get north to places like the Magnificent Mile, it was very easy to use and very cheap. All in all we quite liked this hotel. Location is excellent but you must be aware it is an "older" type property and there are pitfalls to that such as the thin walls, banging pipes etc. The staff are spot on, the best Travelodge staff I have ever come across and they will help you with information and directions. I would be wary of booking just a double room if you are quite tall, the bed is really not big enough. Apart from that, it is fine an considering the price, a reasonable option for a stay in this magnificent city.

Reviews.Title: “NOT worth the price”
Reviews.Author: LondonLove330
Reviews.Content: Staff was pleasant. Room was relatively clean. HOWEVER: -entire hotel smelled of sewage or something like it -room was small and unattractive -towels were small, rough, and very worn -pillows were like something you'd find in a hospital. Bed not much better -hotel in general is not well kept. The elevator was slow and the door was damaged. Light fixtures were crooked. We were supposed to stay 3 nights and were lucky to switch to the Hilton Chicago after our first night. This place was not worth what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “DIrty and up clean”
Reviews.Author: mallshorn
Reviews.Content: Having arrived in Chicago I was looking forward to getting my head down. It would appear that I had been booked into a smoking room after requesting a non smoking room. The room smelt disgusting and looked like it was cleaned like two weeks ago. It still had in plan site fag butts on top of the mirror in the bathroom. None of the fittings in the bathroom fitted. I left the next morning; I would never stay in a Travel Lodge hotel again....

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Kirkland_Traveller
Reviews.Content: If you're going to stay here, be realistic about what to expect. This is not a fancy hotel. It probably wasn't fancy when it first opened. The rooms are small, the decor is dated and the elevators are slow. The location, however, can't be beat and prices are very reasonable. The hotel is literally a block away from Millennium Park. The rooms are clean, and I felt safe walking around the area at night. With my AAA card, the rate was $100 per night, plus tax. The El stops just a couple of blocks away, which is handy. As with most places in Chicago, parking is expensive - I think I heard a rate of $20 per day. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Great Ice Hunt 2006”
Reviews.Author: mrcelery
Reviews.Content: Average hotel at best. Grumpy reception on arriving. Noisy room, mainly from the air conditioner. Smallish rooms by US standards. Tired room and bathroom, but clean. No refridgerators, only ice machines on a few floors, none of which had ice on a hot night. Comical seeing all the guests wandering the floors with buckets searching in vain for a working one. When one finally was found the word got around and it was quickly emptied by guests from every floor! AA lost our bags, but returned them 24 hours later to the hotel, but the hotel kept insisting that they had not arrived. Finally found a helpful porter who checked the luggage area properly, just before we had to fly out again. Cafeteria served plain but OK food. Location was excellent though, for the foreshore parks.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel's Fine By Me!”
Reviews.Author: LeeBrillo
Reviews.Content: I had a 10 night stay at this hotel from 11th Sept to 21st Sept. I must say that after reading the reviews for the hotel prior to the trip I was a little apprehensive as to what would await. I needn't have worried. The hotel was a 2 minute walk from Harrison on the Red Line or a 5 minute walk from Jackson on the Blue Line direct from O'Hare. We paid $95.00 for the room per night, plus the 15.4% Room Tax. The room had 2 double beds which were quite comfortable. The television worked fine as did the clock radio. We were given 2 coffee filter bags per day for the coffee machine. The in-room safe was a big help, plenty of room for A4 size documents and valuables and although it said we would be charged a dollar a day for the use of the safe this wasn't added to our bill. The bathroom was clean, the shower was nice and powerful although on one morning the water didn't get very hot. New soaps and shampoos were supplied every day. The air conditioning unit was fairly modern and worked fine, keeping the room cool. The room itself was kept clean apart from a few nooks and crannies which could've done with a bit of vacuuming. Our room looked out onto Harrison and Wabash and so the El Trains were quite noisy day and night, but we got used to it. The lifts worked fine although, as there were only 2 for public use, they were quite busy. There was a free copy of USA Today at reception although these were usually gone by about 0830-0900. The diner just off the lobby was always busy and we had a decent breakfast in there a couple of times. There's a Subway and a Dunkin Donuts across the street and a couple of Corner Cafes within a 5 minute walk. Although most pubs and bars are an El ride away at River North we did find a fine watering hole on Wabash, Millers Pub. Another good one was Kaseys Bar on Plymouth Court. The area around the hotel seemed safe day and night, helped by the fact that there are so many students in the area. All in all, a decent hotel and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: selinakate2003
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Chicago for 3 days before starting our route 66 tour. We were on a budget which reflects in the hotel but all we wanted was somewhere clean & a bed for 3 nights. The position is unbelieveable and we couldnt believe how close we were to everything. Chicago is amazing & we would definitely stay in the hotel again purely on its location.

Reviews.Title: “expect a place to crash”
Reviews.Author: oneeddy1
Reviews.Content: older hotel with the basics. right next to the buckingham fountain and by the city trolley which is free, and to the harrisson red line. a couple restaurants, baskin robbins, and liquor stores. area seemed safe to stroll around. you'll probably need a taxi if you return to hotel in evening. GET AN OVERSIZED ROOM! you'll have 2 dbl beds and a kitchennette with a micro/fridge. also got a crib with out problem. hallways are narrow and no view from rooms. about a 20-30 min walk to navy pier.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottl101
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week on vacation. This was a terrible hotel. The check in took forever because the counter person couldnt find my reservation, even when I gave him the reservation number. He couldnt type it in correctly. Then the elevatores were broke and could only use the freight evelevator. We were on the 12th floor so it took a while for the elevator to become available. The room itself was very dirty and smelly.
