There was an iron burn on the carpet. The ac unit didnt keep the room cool at all. I needed more towels in the room and called to the front desk for more, they told me they were out. I also need more toilet paper, I called for that 3 times and it never came. I finally had to take some out of the house keeping cart. I will never stay at this hotel again. The Congress right next door is a much better hotel and its the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, Smelly Place”
Reviews.Author: SteveandLiz
Reviews.Content: Here's the main problems we encountered: first, our non-smoking room reeked of cigarette smoke. We think it was coming through the bathroom vent. Second, the tiny window was blocked mostly by the window A/C, and what was not was flithy. Thirdly, our young son dropped a CD on the floor and it rolled under the bed... when he pulled it out, it was covered with big gobs of dust. Very discusting. Finally, the lobby had no A/C when we were there (94 deg F). Room A/C was fine. All of the carpets were very old and stained, but that's tolerable. Our room was tiny (not like the pictures at all). The location is great. And, despite the other reviews, our experience with the staff was fine. If this really is the only place you can afford, then do it. But, I'd keep looking and see if you can find a special/better deal somewhere else. Chicago is a great city... if you can afford a few more bucks, it's money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night for "Taste of Chicago". The location was great for what we needed and the girl at the front counter was very nice. The rooms are small but we tend not to spend much time in the hotel when we travel to Chicago. Basically it's just a place to sleep and/or freshen up before going out again. A few complaints about our room (807) were that the A/C didn't work and the remote control for the TV didn't work either. We did have a problem with the family in the room next to ours. Not sure what time (12:30am or so) the slamming doors, screaming kids and parents yelling at the kids started but apparently we weren't the only ones being disturbed because security was called up to their room. If your looking for fairly cheap accomodations in good locations this and the Red Roof Inn are places we have stayed. They are nothing special but are close to everything. We have been to Chicago 5 times and 4 of those were overnight. You're in Chicago go out and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the staff...”
Reviews.Author: Suzy2110
Reviews.Content: I spent four days at the Downtown Travelodge earlier this month. The location is great- I could see the Sears Tower and the lake from my bedroom window- and the room itself fine, though the bathroom was a little bit worn and there was a cigarette burn on the bathtub. My real gripe with this place was the mind bendingly rude staff. As a single woman traveller, I asked upon check in if it was safe for me to go out on my own in the evening. Not an unreasonable request, I think. You would have thought I had just put some kind of slur on the receptionist's family, the way he reacted! After snapping at me that it was very safe, and that "the police are round every 24 hrs or so" (yeah, great....), I asked what time it got dark. Again, not unreasonable as I was on my own, and a woman. This resulted in further sighing and rolling of eyes, and he would not answer my question, just kept saying "it's very safe, Ma'am", which wasn't what I was asking!!! My room was barely cleaned the whole time I was there, and in fact on one of the days I got back to my room at 4pm to find that noone had actually cleaned it at all that day. The cleaner tapped on the door at about 4.30pm, but I needed to get ready to go and visit some friends and it didn't suit by then. My BIGGEST gripe however was their phones. I did have a phone card, but when it ran out I was unable to top it up as I came from a different country. I then discovered that the hotel has barred their payphone in the lobby from making international calls. In dire straights and needing to speak to my husband, I used the room phone. Charges were stated in their room info as $3.50 "plus charges". I knew the cost would be bad and as a result only stayed on the phone for 3 mins 53 seconds. Upon checking out, they tried to charge me $105 for this call, which I flatly refused to pay. They refused to let me speak to the manager and an ugly argument developed, resulting in them dramatically reducing this charge, but it just made my blood BOIL! OK, whine over! If you're looking for a great location and don't care about extreme rudeness, it's very reasonable for the location. Otherwise, don't touch it with a bargepole! Chicago is a great place, I had a great time apart from that!

Reviews.Title: “Damn right I got the blues”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge Downtown for a week in June 2006 incorporating the 4 day Blues Festival ( free and absolutely awesome for blus aficionados). The location is excellent, as buses and the EL( metro network) are within easy walking distance. The hotel itself is good value, but very basic. If you want a fabulous view of either the brilliant architecture or Lake Michigan, forget it. The hotel is old and the type of carpets make it difficult to keep clean. The hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful. The room had adequate space for two and was O.K. There were not many bars and restaurants in the vincinity, but it was 10 minutes walk to Jackson and Wabash and Adams and Wabash which have some late night eateries such as Millers Pub or the Exchequer. It was only 5 minutes walk from Buddy Guys Legends Club which has live music nightly for a $10-00 cover charge where the drinks are no more expensive than elsewhere. If you are on a budget and are happy with just having a functional place to rest , then I would recommend the Travelodge

Reviews.Title: “Not a great place -- but I might go back.”
Reviews.Author: brufanatic
Reviews.Content: This hotel about thirty steps away from a fabulous neighborhood, where hotels are three times the price. So -- if you can get beyond the slightly rundown, mildly malodorous lobby, and if the incredibly slow elevators arrive before you totally lose your mind to bring you to your rooms, which may or may not be ready at check-in time...(ours wasn't...) You'll find yourself in an acceptable room at a pretty dumpy hotel next to a great neighborhood on the fringe of Grant Park. So plan your days accordingly, enjoy Chicago, and only come back to sleep. If you follow those guidelines, you'll have a decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel unless you can sleep through anything”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only good thing I can say about this hotel is that it was more or less clean. That's it. It is an old, rundown hotel that the owners don't feel they need to keep up because it's in such a good location. There is no sound deadening in the entire building. I heard babies crying, the ice machine dumping ice every 20 minutes, the pipes banging loudly (the steam heating), and the "L" running a block away. Our toilet wasn't working correctly and continuously flushed for 4 hours in the middle of the night. All that for $150/night (hotel and parking). Yes, it's in an expensive area of Chicago, but it still doesnâ€™t change the fact I felt like I was robbed. We were planning on staying two nights, and checked out after just one. I had never been to happy to sleep in my own bed the following night.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Grant Park”
Reviews.Author: bisco
Reviews.Content: Typical Travelodge ammenities. Very close to L. Beverage store nearby. Stayed here during Lollapalooza last summer. Walking distance to Grant Park. Will stay again next August. Just wish there were more restaurants/bars in area. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “It's what I expected...a no frills accommodation with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: seoultous
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge is an old hotel with some updating. First, the staff was very helpful. We had 2 issues that were satisfactorily addressed within 30 minutes. The room was larger than most double rooms. There was a wet bar, fridge, and microwave that looked new. The bathroom was clean and updated. The beds were fine, though the sheets were worn. If this is important to you I would recommend you pack your own. The furnishings were budget and well used. The room was warm and generally very quiet. We did hear the radiator pipes once each night but none of us found the sound intrusive. We used the air conditioning to counter balance the room's excessive warmth. Access was the best part of this hotel. We could get anywhere via the Red Line or short walk. I want to say I would stay here again, but I probably won't. It's not that it was so bad, its just that I am used to much better accommodations. If I were a student or on a strict budget, I would certainly stay here. It's safe, cheap, fairly clean and comfortable enough. At $100 a nite in Chicago, what more does one expect?

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: 1smartdog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge from June 2nd thru June 5th. We had rooms 715 & 718. We were pleasantly surprised. The rooms looked much better than the pictures from the internet. The rooms were large and had been recently renovated. We even had a microwave & mini-fridge, which we weren't expecting. The hotel is old but is in good shape. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were within 3 blocks of the El station and 2 blocks from the Subway station. We bought a multi day pass at the hostel nearby which was good on all public transits- bus, subway and El so we could get anywhere we wanted for mega-cheap. We felt safe on the public transits and had fun trying to figure out how to get there. The concierge recommended a nearby pub for dinner and gave us a 10% off coupon. It is called the Exchequer Pub and we loved the food. We bumped into Will Ferrell on our way to the pub- he is filming a new movie downtown 2 blocks from the hotel. That was cool too. We paid $81 for our rooms and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is !!!”
Reviews.Author: HairyO
Reviews.Content: This is a Travelodge not a full feature upmarket 5 star hotel. If you remember this then you get a decent hotel in a superb location near to the sights and transport of Chicago. OK the hotel is a bit run down in places and is not the best looking building in the world but we had a comfortable clean room with 2 double beds, the bathroom plumbing worked well and the staff were friendly and helpful. Over a stay of a week the room rate varied from $85 to $110, a lot less than any other hotel in the area. Sure you could get a better hotel at this price if you want to stay miles from anywhere, but whatâ€™s the point in visiting a city if you stay way out in the suburbs. Would I stay at this hotel again? My answer is that if I am paying yes, if I can persuade somebody else to pay then I would stay somewhere plusher but in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Good Value for Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I actually found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Showed us where we needed to go on the map - quickly sent up an iron to our room when requested. The reason to stay here is clearly the location for the price. The rooms are a bit worn and the hallways have seen better days, but its not too bad. Its very easy to take the train to the hotel - take the blue line from o'Hare and transfer to the Red Line (going south) and exit Harrison costs $1.75 vs. $38 for a cab and no rush hour traffic. The hotel is a short block away from the train stop.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, Rude Staff, Just kept getting worse.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel for three nights at a special rate, was not given the rate when I got there. The hotel actually lost track of us and considered us a NO SHOW! Due to this we did not get housekeeping service the first two days! I must say that the size of the room was nice and spacious. view was to be as expected for the city. Staff was very rude and they just got worse, we did manage to find one front desk clerk that attempted to help us but however that ended up not working out as well. Every time we left our room we ended up going back down to the front desk and have our room key reset, and it was not due to us storing it next to a credit card. Several members of the staff spoke broken english to the point of not understanding our questions and concerns. I would not ever recommend this to anyone. I thought I was getting a great deal but it would have been worth paying a bit more to stay at a neighboring hotel, because the location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “What I had expected”
Reviews.Author: ihatedriving
Reviews.Content: The room was nothing special, but it was comfortable and cheap. It is about the cheapest place in that part of the city. I was happy with the cheap and close parking. Overall I have no complaints and I think that anyone complaining about this place should look at how much they paid for it and then ask themself what they actually expected for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay was truly awful. I was in Chicago for a job interview, and they didn't make my stay any less stressful. My bed was broken, I had to sleep at an angle all night. We got trapped in a broken elevator on my way to the interview! Talk about stress. The front desk man was very rude, and the room was about half the size of an SF studio apartment! Trust me, that is very tiny. Overall, I rate our experience the worst possible rating.

Reviews.Title: “staff with no manners”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at this hotel again! Look, I am very tolerant person and hardly ever complain about where I stay, but this time I decided to say few words about Travelodge Hotel in downtown Chicago. We were on a red eye flight from Newark NJ to Chicago after all night spent at the airport. After arriving to the hotel at 7:30 am we were told that rooms are not ready and wonâ€™t be given to us until 3pm! We called a day ahead to make sure everything was ok with our early arrival and the clerk confirmed with us that our room would be ready when we get there. To our surprise it was not, and the clerk made it clear to us that he would not give us the room because they were not cleaned on time. How long does it take to clean a room....all day?? When requested a managerâ€™s help, he said, â€œIt does not matter what the manager will doâ€�. Is this an appropriate to a customer? There were other people at the lobby who were turned down by the same clerk. This is not a good way to conduct a business! Well, we were almost on the verge of leaving but hated to loose a great Internet deal for flight plus the hotel. Our group had to spend almost entire day wondering around the streets looking for a spot to rest. Finally the room was given to us punctually at 3:00 pm, just like he said in the morning. The room was not too clean and smelly. We tried to refresh the air inside, but the AC system didnâ€™t seem to work properly leaving us sleeping and breading the stinky air. Next day the same clerk asked us politely if we got a good rest, and we jokingly replied that the pullout sofa bed is fantastic! It made a huge smile on his face, and deep inside we knew that he kept us all day on the street on purpose. BE AWARE OF THIS PLACE. It is true sometimes that you get what you pay for, but I tend to give a credit to those who try to make customer happy. The staff from Travelodge Downtown in Chicago did not even tried to make an affort towards it's customers. Trust me, I've stayed in biggest dumps around the world, but everywhere the staff did something to make a smile on my face.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, and not very chic”
Reviews.Author: tilda54
Reviews.Content: The main attraction of this hotel was the location, and then the price. I was disappointed to find that the "restaurant" -- a rather grubby looking Chinese place -- was closed for repairs, and that the coffee shop -- very run down -- had limited hours. The room was tiny, rather grungy, and featured an incrediyl dirty window. I doubt, even at the price, I would stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge Chicago Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 65 East Harrison Street, Wabash St & Harrison St, Chicago, IL 60605
